runners.name: Gunlock
runners.comment: Respectable fifth in similar race to this at Kempton on return; needs to build on that
runners.spotlight: Won 1m AW Newcastle maiden for Karl Burke last spring; didn't progress and was sold for 3,500gns in December, but respectable fifth in similar race to this at Kempton on reappearance (with hood and tongue-tie added); needs to build on that.

runners.name: Billy Mill
runners.comment: Beaten under 2l when fifth of 16 in C&D Class 3 handicap in January; chance on that level
runners.spotlight: Patchy form but has run a number of good races in defeat at this venue, beaten under 2l when fifth of 16 in C&D Class 3 handicap in January; chance if at that level.

stable_tour.quote: He's a horse we bought from Richard Hannon. He runs mostly on the all-weather because he wouldn't handle firm ground and he wouldn't go on heavy and we've been pretty successful with him. He loves Newcastle, it's just a shame that my yard is so far away from Newcastle! We've won three races with him up there. He's just a good old horse and very genuine. 11-07-24

runners.name: Cill Mocheallog
runners.comment: Lightly raced; useful winner in Ireland last year; lost his way but has had a breathing op
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced; useful winner in Ireland last year; lost his way but had a breathing operation since last seen in December; tongue-tie added.

runners.name: Lady Flora
runners.comment: Has run fine in two AW handicaps elsewhere since resuming this year; more to give
runners.spotlight: Has run fine in two AW handicaps elsewhere since resuming this year, most recently unsuited by steadily run 7f in Class 3 at Newcastle; still looks to have more to give.

runners.name: Kitaro Kich
runners.breeder: Airlie Stud & Mrs S M Rogers
runners.owner: J Machale, S Tucker & S Jewell
runners.comment: In good form, three wins already this year, one of them around here, but up from Class 6
runners.spotlight: In good form, including three wins already this year, one of them around here, but is up from Class 6.

runners.name: Wheres Freddy
runners.comment: In form; this test should be fine for him and he's drawn to save ground; contender
runners.spotlight: All three wins gained over 7f, including Wolverhampton two starts back, and ran well at Southwell latest in a race that didn't unfold to suit; this test should be fine for him and he's drawn to save ground; contender.

runners.name: Charming Whisper
runners.owner: Exors Of Serafino Agodino & P J Mcbride
runners.comment: Contender if building on recent reappearance fifth in a similar race over C&D
runners.spotlight: Two turf handicap wins last year; contender if building on recent reappearance fifth in a similar race over C&D.

quotes.race: Country & Town House Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: The handicapper can't put Charming Whisper up too much and he's always been a nice little horse. He was fresh and boiled over a little bit first time out and he can get a bit warm. He's learning - Charlie McBride, trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Juddmonte EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands C and D) (EBF Restricted Race Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Charming Whisper was very cheap through the sales ring because he was a rig. We had to take him home and bring him to Rossdales [Newmarket vet surgeons] to have an operation, but he hasn't looked back ever since. I actually didn't realise what a valuable race it was, but it is terrific to pick up this prize-money with such a cheaply bought horse. I think all the owners backed him at 50-1 too! - Charlie McBride, trainer.

runners.name: Benacre
runners.comment: Needs to come back to form, but this test is fine and he's handily weighted on his best
runners.spotlight: Needs to come back to form but that's possible after four months off over a test that's fine for him and from a ground-saving draw; he's handily weighted on his best form.

runners.name: Court Of Session
runners.comment: Three-time C&D winner but needs to rediscover some form and must overcome widest draw
runners.spotlight: Three-time C&D winner but needs to rediscover some form and must overcome widest draw.

runners.name: A Major Payne
runners.comment: Had only four starts, showing fair ability; still has potential for yard in flying form
runners.spotlight: Had only four starts, showing fair ability; off since well beaten at Newmarket on handicap debut in November, but still has potential; half-brother to six winners with RPRs ranging from 79-103; stable is in flying form.

runners.name: Flag Of St George
runners.comment: Close third in similar race to this at Southwell latest; contender on that form
runners.spotlight: Close third in similar race to this at Southwell latest; contender on that form.

runners.name: Swiss Ace

prev_owners.owner: The Bottom Liners & Mrs R Carr
Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor

runners.comment: Typically races over shorter and last three wins gained in 7f AW Newcastle handicaps
runners.spotlight: Typically races over shorter and last three wins gained in 7f AW Newcastle handicaps, latest 2023; unplaced under those conditions latest; others are preferred.

7:00.race_name: It's Never Ordinary At bet365 Handicap

runners.name: Secret Handsheikh
runners.comment: Ten-time winner elsewhere but unproven around this track and has been off since October
runners.spotlight: Ten-time winner elsewhere but unproven around this track and has been off since October, so others preferred.

quotes.race: Get Your Ladbrokes Daily Odds Boost Handicap
quotes.quote: Secret Handsheikh was a convincing winner last time and went up 9lb but he loves this surface. He skips off the surface and has such a good attitude - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

runners.name: General Assembly
runners.comment: Non-runner
runners.spotlight: Non-runner.

runners.name: Leodis Dream
runners.comment: Has won over C&D; poor run at Newcastle two back but showed up well at Southwell latest
runners.spotlight: Has won over C&D; poor run at Newcastle two starts back but showed up well at Southwell since, over 6f which stretched him (all wins at 5f); still, others preferred.

quotes.race: Constant Security Handicap
quotes.quote: Leodis Dream has been poor but showed signs of a revival at Wolverhampton. He only came here because I was struggling for places to run him so I'm chuffed he's won - Paul Midgley, trainer.

runners.name: Diamond Dreamer
runners.comment: Five AW wins elsewhere; his level dipped at Wolverhampton latest but that was 6f
runners.spotlight: Five AW wins elsewhere; his level dipped at Wolverhampton latest but that was 6f, which he might not want these days, and he was placed at Lingfield (5f) in his two runs before that; chance.

runners.name: Angle Land

prev_owners.owner: K Dasmal, A Rix, R Penney

runners.comment: On 12-race losing run but met some trouble at Southwell latest and has won over C&D
runners.spotlight: On 12-race losing run but met some trouble at Southwell latest and has won over C&D; still, not as appealing as some.

quotes.race: QuinBet Daily Free Bet Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Angle Land is a tough filly and that was a good performance with 10st 2lb on her back - Neil Callan, jockey.

runners.name: Birkenhead
runners.comment: Encouragement at Southwell on second run after a break; handily weighted
runners.spotlight: Encouragement at Southwell on recent second run after a break; has never raced here but is handily weighted, so could be involved.

quotes.race: Sky Bet "Jump Jockeys' Nunthorpe" Handicap (To Be Ridden By Professional Jump Jockeys)
quotes.quote: It took a while for BIRKENHEAD to click but he's not done anything wrong since-Paul Midgley, trainer

stable_tour.quote: We bought him off Les Eyre and he wasn't a lot of money, and if you'd said to me a fortnight after we bought him that he would win the jump jockeys' race at York, I'd have said you were on a different planet. He's a funny little horse; when he's in form, he's in form, and when he isn't in form, he isn't. He's really easy to train and he's been great but he's frustrating at times as he does what he likes. To be fair to him, he's a fast-ground horse but he won on soft at Catterick the time before last. It was soft ground that you could go through and a few of the fancied ones didn't run because the ground changed overnight and we thought we'd got nothing to lose. We'd got an outside stall, where we could get over to the golden highway, and the worst thing we could do was get beat. After about a furlong, he was never going to get beat. We tried to do the same there last time but he just got beat by a progressive one of Bryan Smart's. He's paying his way, whiis great, and hopefully he'll continue to do so. 28-06-24

runners.name: Merrimack
runners.comment: Twice runner-up in similar races here over the winter; can be excused below-par run latest
runners.spotlight: Twice runner-up in similar races here over the winter; can be excused below-par run from wide draw at Lingfield latest; has been off for two months, but handily enough weighted.

runners.name: Dark Side Prince
runners.comment: Five C&D wins including this race last year; needs to rediscover some form
runners.spotlight: Five C&D wins including this race last year; needs to rediscover some form but may be better for recent Wolverhampton spin which came off a 95-day break; drawn widest.

runners.name: Alafdhal
runners.comment: Has won here four times; most recently runner-up in Wolverhampton Class 6
runners.spotlight: Has won here four times; most recently runner-up at Wolverhampton, although is now back up from Class 6; gets a headgear switch.

quotes.race: Support The Injured Jockeys Fund Handicap
quotes.quote: They went hard up front which helped Alafdhal and the race fell apart. That's four from four around here now and he's done well to come through as he has had his health issues and has also had me running him over the wrong trip - Phil McEntee, trainer.

8:30.race_name: Watch Live Racing At bet365 Handicap

runners.name: Lightening Mann
runners.comment: Won 1m Lingfield maiden on recent reappearance; up in trip again for handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Delivered on last summer's 2yo promise when winning 1m Lingfield maiden on reappearance outing three weeks ago; upped in trip again and has tongue-tie fitted for this handicap debut; should still have more to offer.

quotes.race: Win Â£1M With BetMGM's Golden Goals Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: Lightening Mann will improve lots too. He's still got to iron out a few things, but we've always liked him, and after running at Doncaster in July last year we gelded him and gave him a break with this year in mind - Jack Channon, trainer.

runners.name: Lady Chartwell
runners.comment: Made the frame on two of her three 7f turf starts last summer; can improve this year
runners.spotlight: Made the frame on two of her three 7f turf starts last summer and has plenty of scope for improvement in middle-distance handicaps this year; must be considered.

runners.name: Jiffs Army
runners.comment: 1m Lingfield maiden winner; safely held on handicap debut; moves up in trip today
runners.spotlight: Came good when upped to 1m for Lingfield maiden in January, his fifth start, but was rather disappointing on last month's handicap debut at Southwell and will need to kick on again over this new trip.

runners.name: Ruling Master
runners.comment: Second in C&D novice in December and again ran well on handicap debut soon afterwards
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in C&D novice in December and again ran well when third on handicap debut at Wolverhampton (9.4f; first-time cheekpieces) a few days later; a bit more exposed than some of these but probably won't be far away.

runners.name: Must Believe
runners.comment: Placed in recent C&D maiden but has very much record last year; others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden who had a very mixed record last year; returned from break with very respectable third in C&D maiden 19 days ago but others in this line-up have more persuasive profiles.

runners.name: Lady Mariko

runners.spotlight: Kept on for respectable fifth of seven on last month's handicap debut at Newcastle (1m) but her modest fourth at Southwell a few days later was a shade disappointing; needs to up her game over this longer trip.

runners.name: Hibernate

runners.spotlight: Well down the field on both Irish turf starts in the autumn (1m1f/7f) and fared no better for new stable at Southwell (1m) in November (gelded soon afterwards); needs to take a big step forward on this handicap debut.

runners.name: Glenridding
runners.comment: Made solid start to nursery career in September/October; moves up in trip after break
runners.spotlight: Scored on nursery debut at Yarmouth (1m, good) in September and was third off today's mark on consecutive outings the following month (8.6f/1m); has fitness to prove after 147-day absence but further progress is possible over middle-distance trips this year.

runners.name: Bellator Bullet
runners.breeder: M S And C S Griffiths
runners.comment: Runner-up on last summer's debut but went the wrong way afterwards; back from a break
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on last summer's Redcar debut (7f, good) but all three subsequent runs were disappointing; can be excused his heavy-ground defeat in October (handicap debut) but returns to action with quite a bit to prove.

4:55.race_name: British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Blue Rc
runners.comment: Half-brother to a useful AW sprint winner for the same connections; hooded for debut
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to a useful AW sprint winner for the same connections; hooded for this debut; withdrawn after getting upset in the stalls ahead of intended introduction at Wolverhampton earlier this month, when he was a 17-2 shot in a similar race to this.

runners.name: Dream Out Loud
runners.comment: Modest form in finishing runner-up in two 6f AW events elsewhere; more needed
runners.spotlight: Modest form in finishing runner-up in two 6f AW events elsewhere; probably needs to do more.

runners.spotlight: Fair ability first two starts last year, notably second in 6f AW Kempton novice, before struggling on soft turf in September; has an absence to overcome, but bred to make a decent sprinter and sets the standard; newly gelded.

stable_tour.quote: We love him. He was coming to win at Kempton last time and jumped where the stalls were for the 1m4f race just as they quickened. Oisin Murphy said he was half a length down and he ended up being two lengths behind the winner. I didn't think he'd win on the night but Oisin is adamant he would have. He'll go to Newbury on Friday for a 6f maiden. 18-09-24

runners.name: Juba
runners.comment: Looked to show ability on soft turf last year but form isn't robust; off since September
runners.spotlight: Looked to show fair ability when sixth in 6f soft-ground Newbury maiden in September on second start, but there was a bunched finish so it may be unreliable form and he has been off since; dam won on the AW.

runners.name: Sir Kenny

prev_owners.owner: Catch Us If You Can Racing Two

runners.comment: 1,000gns yearling; 100-1 when tailed off in 1m heavy-ground Bath novice in October
runners.spotlight: 1,000gns yearling; 100-1 when tailed off in 1m heavy-ground Bath novice in October; has since had a breathing operation; unappealing.

runners.name: Special Acclaim
runners.comment: 32,000gns yearling; by a good sprint sire, although already gelded
runners.spotlight: 32,000gns yearling; by a good sprint sire, although already gelded; hard to know what to expect on his debut.

runners.name: Cooramook
runners.comment: Caught the eye when fifth in 7f Wolverhampton fillies' novice in October on second start
runners.spotlight: Caught the eye when fifth in 7f Wolverhampton fillies' novice in October on second start; off since, but this 100,000gns yearling could turn out useful and the drop in trip doesn't look a bad move.

runners.name: Desert Beauty
runners.comment: By a good sire but there's less appeal on the dam's side of her pedigree
runners.spotlight: By a good sire but there's less appeal on the dam's side of her pedigree; hard to know what to expect on debut, but she's the sole ride on the card for a jockey who has been firing in the winners in the UAE (26 and counting this term) and who'll be having his first mount in Britain this year.

runners.name: Star Legend
runners.comment: Long-standing maiden on Flat but short-head second in 2m Class 5 handicap here in February
runners.spotlight: Long-standing maiden on the Flat but short-head second in 2m Class 5 handicap here in February; has won twice over hurdles; below form at Southwell last week and now gets a headgear switch, but player if back to himself.

stable_tour.quote: He was quite a shock winner at Fakenham last time but he'd just dropped into a lower grade. He does really well around Fakenham, which is really nice as it's a track I love supporting. We've just set up a syndicate to sell him to more local people, which will mean he'll keep running at local tracks like Fakenham and Huntingdon. 01-01-25

runners.name: Blue Sky Boy
runners.comment: Lightly raced maiden; runner-up in C&D Class 5 handicap two starts back; cheekpieces on
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced maiden; runner-up in C&D Class 5 handicap two starts back; suffered interference at Southwell latest which exaggerated the beaten margin; has been off for two months; cheekpieces added.

runners.spotlight: First past the post in four 2m Class 6 handicaps on the AW elsewhere since November; below form at Newcastle latest (took keen hold) and now fitted with cheekpieces, but might still have more to give.

runners.name: The Colorist

runners.spotlight: Capable handicapper on AW around 1m4f; below form latest but that was 2m and he weakened having tried to make ground up wide on the home bend; this test ought to be okay for him; gets a headgear switch.

runners.name: Duchess
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Logis Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Earl Haras Du Logis & Black Type Limited

runners.comment: Placed in 1m4f Class 6 Newcastle handicaps on last two starts; this trip within reach
runners.spotlight: Placed in 1m4f Class 6 Newcastle handicaps on last two starts; this trip within reach; chance.

runners.name: Kracking
runners.comment: Free-goer who has not been getting home in his recent races; drops back in trip today
runners.spotlight: Free-goer who has not been getting home in recent races; on a good mark now and may benefit from today's drop back in trip but still looks risky.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld, Dubai Apprentice Handicap (Whips To Be Carried, But Not Used) (RE Series)
quotes.quote: Kracking jumped well and travelled along really well. He was always doing enough and I never really felt any pressure from another horse. Mr [Stuart] Williams was confident so I just let him bowl along. I'm happy to be back with Mr Hannon doing what I love. I could do with an agent to keep the ball rolling into the winter and get a few more rides - Tyrese Cameron, jockey.

runners.name: Stella Hogan

runners.spotlight: Has some quirks but is 2-6 for new stable since the autumn, the latter win gained over C&D in today's headgear combination three weeks ago; drops back in trip after decent 1m third here a week later; likely to be on the premises again.

prev_owners.owner: Mrs A M Sturges , Ilka Gansera-Leveque

runners.name: Francisco

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Kondratiev Wave had plenty of pace we thought. He might prefer a little bit further but with the soft ground his stamina came into play. We've always liked him - Kieran Cotter, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's been very good this year, winning twice and finishing in the first three another four times. He ran last night at Chelmsford in the 7f handicap. 07-08-24

runners.name: Got No Dollars
runners.comment: 1m course winner in January; still on workable mark but this drop back to 7f is not ideal
runners.spotlight: Kept on well for narrow 1m course win in January and is still on a workable mark but Kempton last month was disappointing and this drop back to 7f may not be ideal.

runners.name: Just Rita
runners.comment: Ran well on second of two stable starts but is 0-15 overall; not the percentage call
runners.spotlight: 15-race maiden; bettered disappointing stable debut when second at Southwell (7f) in January but raced too freely and was below that form there 16 days ago; not the percentage call.

runners.name: Flag Carrier

runners.spotlight: Has modest 1-21 strike-rate but was unlucky not to finish closer to the target in first-time cheekpieces here (6f; denied clear run) last month; goes without headgear today but will be suited by the move back up in trip and continues to lurk on a dangerous mark.

runners.name: Thomas Equinas
runners.comment: Needs to better his recent efforts but was a C&D winner off 1lb higher in October
runners.spotlight: Runs this track very well and is now 1lb lower than scoring in refitted cheekpieces over C&D in October; needs to up his game after some below-par recent efforts but can't be ruled out.

runners.name: One For Harvey
runners.comment: Lightly raced maiden; has run well here but needs to do way more than on reappearance
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced maiden; has run well here but needs to do way more than on reappearance at Lingfield; cheekpieces added.

runners.name: Off The Bench
runners.comment: Moderate maiden who was tailed off in 7f Wolverhampton race when last seen six months ago
runners.spotlight: Moderate maiden who was tailed off in 7f Wolverhampton race when last seen six months ago; now with another new trainer.

runners.spotlight: Headstrong; unplaced in six 6f-1m AW/turf starts for George Boughey including tried in headgear which is now removed; however, was twice well supported in the market, and the booking of Rossa Ryan catches the eye; might prove capable of better.

runners.name: Top Star
runners.comment: Unplaced in six 5f-6f AW/turf starts for Richard Hughes last year, but may do better now
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in six 5f-6f AW/turf starts for Richard Hughes last year, but ran okay in similar race to this at Wolverhampton when last seen in September; later sold for 3,500gns; might do better; hood added.

runners.name: Dark Sorceress
runners.comment: Runner-up in similar race over C&D when last seen in October; bit more needed
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in similar race over C&D when last seen in October; bit more needed and five-month absence is off-putting.

runners.name: Tiana Rose

runners.owner: The Ten Fools & A Horse Partnership

runners.name: Clipsham Noble

runners.spotlight: 0-8; hasn't built on last August's 5l third in 7f Class 6 nursery here; back down in trip and visored.

runners.name: Double Mocha

runners.spotlight: Unplaced in three AW maiden/novices elsewhere, most recently dropped to this trip at Kempton, but he may do better now handicapping at a lowly level; newly gelded.

runners.name: Bust A Moon

runners.spotlight: Ex-Eve Johnson Houghton; 0-4; ran okay in C&D maiden before fourth in 7f Class 6 Wolverhampton nursery when last seen in November; potential improver, back down in trip four months on for new trainer.

runners.name: Inconspicuous
runners.comment: Showed up well when fourth in similar race to this at Wolverhampton latest
runners.spotlight: Showed up well when fourth in similar race to this at Wolverhampton latest; capable of having a say.

quotes.race: CGE Yorkshire Rous Selling Stakes (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: That was plenty. We could have bid again but Inconspicuous was a 15,000euros yearling, he's won plenty of prize money and when you start getting up there you've a fair bit of commission to pay. It's a good day. We're not sad. I wish Gay all the luck in the world. It's an open market, we could have bid again, there are no complaints - Ollie Pears, trainer.

runners.name: Cheeky Stanley
runners.comment: Unplaced in three turf sprint maidens last year, but may do better now handicapping
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in three turf sprint maidens last year, but may do better now handicapping in lowly company; hood off.

runners.name: Rock Master
runners.comment: 0-4 and didn't progress last year, but has a useful pedigree and could improve this term
runners.spotlight: 0-4 and didn't progress last year, but has a useful pedigree and could improve this season; cheekpieces added; newly gelded.

runners.name: Rhodes Royce
runners.comment: Unplaced in three 7f/6f AW maiden/novices elsewhere, but now handicapping at low level
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in three 7f/6f AW maiden/novices elsewhere, but now handicapping at low level, so could be competitive.

runners.name: Shes A Dark Horse
runners.comment: Unplaced in six starts last year, the last two coming in C&D Class 6 nursery events
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in six starts last year, the last two coming in C&D Class 6 nursery events; needs to improve.

runners.name: My Boy Harry

runners.spotlight: Well beaten in three maiden/novices for Darryll Holland last year including C&D; much more needed after five months off, but he's a late May foal out of a fair AW winner, so maybe he can progress; newly gelded.

runners.name: Mybad

runners.name: Circus Of Rome
runners.comment: Runner-up in two of his three races and he's the standard-setter in this field
runners.spotlight: Beaten a short-head by the favourite when clear of the rest on his second run at Lingfield (1m) and again ran well at Chelmsford where he seemed to find 7f too sharp (kept on for pressure); he's the standard-setter in this field.

runners.name: Godstone
runners.comment: Showed more second time out at Kempton but was still beaten 8l and that was over 1m4f
runners.spotlight: Showed more second time out at Kempton but was still beaten 8l and that was over 1m4f; looks vulnerable.

runners.name: Lightning Tiger
runners.comment: First foal; dam 1m-1m1f winner (including AW; RPR 96); likely best watched on debut
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam 1m-1m1f winner (including AW; RPR 96) and half-sister to useful 8.5f/9.4f winner Nonchalant; likely best watched on debut.

runners.name: Maraaheb
runners.comment: 42,000euros yearling; hooded for debut but in top hands and needs checking in the betting
runners.spotlight: 42,000euros yearling; twelfth foal; half-brother to seven winners including Opposite (1m-10.5f; RPR 111), Baahama (7.5f-1m4f; 106), Star System (8.5f-10.5f; 95) and Leaders Listen (1m1f; 83); dam 1m1f-1m4f winner (102); hooded for debut but in top hands and needs checking in the betting.

runners.name: Soy Loco
runners.comment: Perhaps flattered at Chelmsford last time but clearly up to winning races
runners.spotlight: Has got closer with each run, last time going down by 1.5l to a Gosden odds-on favourite who had already shown a good level of ability; might have been flattered that day at Chelmsford having dictated up front, but clearly up to winning races.

runners.name: My Mate Arnie
runners.comment: Stable's newcomers are usually best watched and he's drawn wide
runners.spotlight: Third foal; dam 6f 2yo winner (RPR 77), half-sister to winners Stetchworth (1m1f/1m2f), Shamrocked (6f/7f) and Taqwaa (1m); stable's newcomers are usually best watched and he's drawn wide.

runners.name: Camtank
runners.comment: 30,000gns yearling; the only female in the field but she's in a leading stable
runners.spotlight: 30,000gns yearling; eighth foal; half-sister to four winners including Awesometank (7f/1m; RPR 109), Frantanck (1m; RPR 91) and Modern Approach (9.4f; 84); dam 6f 2yo winner (98); the only female in the field but she's in a leading stable.

runners.name: Cinque Verde
runners.comment: 1lb higher than for January's C&D win; latest run not the one to judge her on; chance
runners.spotlight: Good record on AW and she's only 1lb higher than when winning over C&D in January; latest 7f run not the one to judge her on and Hector Crouch a notable booking.

stable_tour.quote: She was in very good form on the all-weather earlier this year, winning five times between February and May. She was fifth at Windsor last week and then sixth there again on Saturday. She may go to Brighton, where she's entered in the Bullet on Friday. 07-08-24

runners.name: El Bufalo
runners.comment: Conditions fine and took well to blinkers at Chelmsford last month; less good latest
runners.spotlight: C&D winner who gained his first handicap success at Chelmsford last month (blinkered first time); not quite in the same form back there two weeks ago; others appeal more.

runners.name: Ecclesiastical
runners.comment: Conditions to suit and won easily at Lingfield 3 weeks ago; up 7lb in a better race
runners.spotlight: Strong traveller who gained compensation for a near miss over C&D last month by easily seeing off six rivals at Lingfield three weeks ago; he hasn't been missed with a 7lb rise though.

quotes.race: Winter Series Awards At Dundalk Stadium Handicap
quotes.quote: Ecclesiastical has been a very consistent horse and had a good solid run the last day, he deserved that. He went a bit left so he's probably worth a little bit more than how far he won - Colin Keane, rider

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: I thought Eccliastical would have won long before now, he always showed us plenty at home. Maybe gelding him has helped. Colin said he was probably in front soon enough and he'd rather have been there a bit later - Tom McCourt, trainer

runners.name: Invincible Speed
runners.comment: C&D win off 3lb higher last July; not shone in two 6f runs for this yard; drop in trip a +
runners.spotlight: Both wins have come at Wolverhampton, the latest over C&D last July (beat Reigning Profit) off a 3lb higher mark; yet to fire in two 6f runs for his new stable but Billy Loughnane takes over today and a revival could be imminent back at 5f.

runners.name: Dashing Harry
runners.comment: On a winning mark and the return to 5f should suit; one for the shortlist
runners.spotlight: Two 5f wins for new connections this winter; return to 5f should suit and he's on his last winning mark; one for the shortlist.

runners.name: Bang On The Bell
runners.comment: More realistically treated again now and no surprise to see him make a bold bid
runners.spotlight: Has struggled with the handicapper after completing an AW double in the first part of 2024; more realistically treated now and well drawn so he can't be ruled out.

runners.name: Catch Cunningham
runners.comment: Comes here in form and he's respected despite the widest stall
runners.spotlight: Conditions to suit and he comes here in good order; will need luck in running and a good pace to aim at but he's capable of a prominent showing; drawn widest.

quotes.race: William Hill Play Responsibly/EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That wasn't ideal. We wanted to take a lead but Catch Cunningham jumped well and no-one wanted to go on. We reverted to plan B and that's hard to do here. But he's very game and genuine. He'll be better in a better race -  Kevin Ryan, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's fast and extremely genuine. He ran well first time out and will go for the five-furlong handicap at York, though he'll get six. 10-05-22

runners.name: Reigning Profit
runners.comment: Saw no daylight on his return to action and a 2lb drop looks kind; C&D winner; chance
runners.spotlight: Two-time C&D winner; saw no daylight at a crucial part of the race on his return from a five-month break at Newcastle this month and has generously been dropped 2lb for his troubles; better expected.

quotes.race: Ripon Races Ladies Day 22nd June Handicap
quotes.quote: He did it well. Reigning Profit broke very quickly so I travelled strongly through the race and I think he was just getting a little tired near the line - James Sullivan, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Go Racing In Yorkshire Future Stars Apprentice Handicap (Round 3)
quotes.quote: Reigning Profit is usually a good eater and he's a solid sprinter so I see no reason why he shouldn't go to Goodwood on Friday - Ruth Carr, trainer.

runners.name: General Assembly
runners.comment: Non-runner
runners.spotlight: Non-runner.

3:20.race_name: Free Bets With BetUK Bet Club Handicap

runners.name: Cogital
runners.comment: Back from long absence when tailed off at Kempton (1m4f) in December; opposable
runners.spotlight: Eight-time winner, including six at a variety of trips on the Flat; well treated on his old form but he returned from a long absence with a tailed-off effort at Kempton (1m4f, Polytrack; 150-1) in December and can only be watched after another break; hood reapplied.

quotes.race: First Cafes Handicap
quotes.quote: Cogital usually runs over further, so I didn't want it to turn into a sprint and wanted to use his stamina up the straight. He's a lovely horse to be fair and ran well last time at Ascot. He was unlucky then and should have been a lot closer. I imagine he'll mix and match with the Flat and jumping - Jordan Williams, rider.

runners.name: Naomhi
runners.comment: Unexposed 5yo and she's a possible improver back up in trip after a break
runners.spotlight: Well held in a bumper on debut and no progress in four Flat runs since, but she made some late gains on her handicap debut over 9.4f here in December; returns after a break and this unexposed 5yo is a possible improver back up in trip.

runners.name: Upepo
runners.comment: Made it 5-16 on AW when scoring over C&D last month; respected up 4lb
runners.spotlight: Improved his AW record to 5-16 when finishing well to justify support over C&D last month; up 4lb but he was as good as ever last time and that was only his third run at this track; respected.

runners.name: Its A Love Thing
runners.comment: Resurgent 7yo who is well treated under a penalty for his win here last time; key player
runners.spotlight: Resurgent 7yo who ended a long losing run at Newcastle (1m2f) three weeks ago and he followed up with a comfortable win here (9.4f) on Saturday; 2lb well in under a penalty for that last success and he's a big player back up in trip.

stable_tour.quote: Jonathan: He ran a strong race when he finished second on the Flat at Newcastle last time and showed he stays 1m4Â½f. He'll probably return to hurdles at Huntingdon on Thursday. He disappointed on his last hurdles run but he made a bad mistake and may have just jarred himself a bit. Sam: He pulled a shoe off and we struggle with his feet, they're big and take a bit of minding. He's another who does a lot of swimming. 08-02-24

runners.name: Bunker Bay
runners.comment: Fair fourth at Southwell but he's now 2-21 and sole win was in 2023; cheekpieces added
runners.spotlight: Returned to the Flat with a respectable fourth at a big price at Southwell (1m3f) last Wednesday; cheekpieces are now added but he's managed just one win from 21 starts and that was in July 2023; others preferred.

stable_tour.quote: A lovely, big scopey horse who'll hopefully get a run at the backend. He'll come into his own next year and we'll start him off over a mile. 03-09-21

runners.name: Media Mogul
runners.breeder: Forenaghts Stud Farm Ltd & Sam Mencoff
runners.comment: Unexposed 4yo who had a near-miss in a Newcastle handicap (1m4f) last time; respected
runners.spotlight: Five-race maiden but he went very close when favourite for a Newcastle handicap (1m4f, Tapeta) three weeks ago; up 3lb but he's open to more progress and is respected with cheekpieces added.

runners.name: Come On John
runners.comment: Hold-up performer who has been in good form recently including a C&D win; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Hold-up performer who won over C&D 24 days ago and he's held his form with good efforts here and at Southwell in two subsequent runs; remains on workable mark and could be a big factor if this sets up for his closing style.

stable_tour.quote: A lovely little horse. He won for us at Southwell in October but has been a little bit unlucky as has been second three times in a row now. He runs at Newcastle on Thursday. 01-01-25

2:50.race_name: Weekly Free Bets With BetMGM Extra Fillies' Handicap

runners.name: Salamanca City
runners.comment: Just one win from ten starts and has some work to do back on AW after an absence
runners.spotlight: Won off 5lb lower at Leicester (1m2f, good to soft) last July but she couldn't pose a serious threat in her final two runs last year; record now stands at 1-10 and has some work to do back on AW after 162 days off.

runners.name: Caramay
runners.comment: Five wins on AW in September-January; held in last three starts but she's not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Won times on AW (9.4f-1m4f) in September-January; held on Tapeta in last three starts but she had some traffic issues at Southwell last time and was beaten less than 2l over C&D on penultimate run; probably still not handicapped out of things and could be a dangerous if she gets a decent pace.

runners.name: Beatrice Shilling
runners.comment: 0-8 but she's on dangerous mark and is one to keep an eye on back in trip
runners.spotlight: 0-7 for Peter Chapple-Hyam and was last of seven on stable debut at Newcastle (1m2f) last month, but she travelled well for a long way and may have needed the run; continues to drop down the weights and she's one to keep an eye on back in trip.

runners.name: Elterwater
runners.comment: Improver who has form figures of 12211 since in November; strong contender
runners.spotlight: Has form figures of 12211 since returning from a break in November and she completed a Chelmsford double (1m2f) in good style last time; up another 4lb but she still looks feasibly treated and is open to more progress back on Tapeta; strong claims.

runners.name: Celebrating Ethel
runners.comment: Sole win was in August 2023 and well held here in last two stats; opposable
runners.spotlight: Runner-up twice here (8.6f/9.4f) in January but she's been well held in last two starts and her sole win was in August 2023; opposable.

quotes.race: Human League Playing Live After Racing Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Celebrating Ethel learned a lot the last day and got a lovely ride from Luke. We might even go back to a mile with her. She is a nice filly and I think she can improve again - Andrew Kinirons, trainer.

5:00.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Handicap (Div I)

runners.name: Pessoa
runners.comment: Five-time course winner, most recently last week; respected back up in trip under penalty
runners.spotlight: Campaigned mostly at Wolverhampton, winning five times including a strong-finishing success over 7f last week; has a penalty but he remains feasibly treated and this step back up in trip is no problem; key player.

runners.name: Voltaic
runners.comment: On workable mark but he's not easy to predict and was quiet here last week
runners.spotlight: Eight-time winner including twice over C&D; his last success was off 1lb higher at Lingfield (7f) in December but he's not hit the same level since and was quiet here last week; regular visor is now removed and others are more persuasive.

quotes.race: alex@alexdonohuepr.co.uk Classified Claiming Stakes
quotes.quote: Voltaic has relished the ground and relaxed over that trip - Sean Levey, rider.

runners.name: Absolutely Not
runners.comment: In good hands and still early days but she needs a transformation on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Showed promise with her debut fifth over C&D last February but she missed 12 months after that and has struggled in two maidens this year; in good hands and still early days but she needs a transformation on handicap debut.

runners.name: Port Noir
runners.breeder: R C Dollar & Hellwood Stud Farm
runners.comment: Six of ten wins have been at this track and she's on a workable mark; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Six of her ten wins have been at this track and last two were in October; wasn't at her best here (9.4f) two weeks ago but she's generally reliable and is now only 1lb higher than for her last success; possibilities.

runners.name: Annalee Lass
runners.owner: Ms N Race And G Lavery
runners.comment: Not easy to predict but she won over C&D on penultimate run; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Not easy to predict and she didn't fire at Newcastle (1m) last time but that was after a brave win in a classified event over C&D; has claims if she can recapture that form and she's not ruled out.

runners.name: Possible Ambition
runners.comment: Lightly raced in last 12 months and has struggled in last three runs; lots to prove
runners.spotlight: Both AW wins have been at Newcastle for previous trainer; fair second of eight on stable debut here (9.4f) last February but he's had only three runs since and has struggled in all of them; lots to prove.

quotes.race: Leicester Racecourse Ideal Christmas Party Venue Selling Stakes
quotes.quote: I thought I was beat. The second horse completely stopped and Possible Ambition got there just inside the furlong and I didn't want to take the momentum back off him because he was waiting on the other horse a little. He won in the end, which is all that matters. He acts on this ground, which is a big help, and it's quite attritional out there -Jason Hart, jockey.

runners.name: Lhebayeb
runners.comment: Fair fourth over C&D latest but he's 0-22 on AW and last turf win was in 2023
runners.spotlight: Returned to form with a front-running fourth over C&D (classified event) ten days ago but that took her AW record to 0-22 and her last turf win was 17 months ago; down the list.

runners.name: Blue Jay Way
runners.comment: 16-race maiden who still has stamina to prove at this trip; best watched on return
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent 16-race maiden who was well held at Redcar (6f, soft) in his final run last year; still has stamina to prove at this trip and looks best watched from 142 days off.

runners.name: Haaf A Diamond
runners.owner: Dr M Voikhansky & Mrs S Voikhanskaya
runners.comment: Out of sorts last year and needs a major revival after six months off
runners.spotlight: Won a 1m handicap at Leicester (good) in June 2023 but she was out of sorts in her five runs last year; still unexposed on AW but she needs a major revival after six months off.

runners.name: Scarfo
runners.comment: Held in sixth here in last two runs and he's now 1-16; others look stronger
runners.spotlight: Some respectable efforts this year but he's been held in sixth here (7f/8.6f) in his last two runs and overall record now stands at 1-16; others look stronger.

3:50.race_name: Â£30 In Free Bets With BetUK Classified Stakes (Div I)

runners.name: My Turn Now
runners.comment: Won 4 of her last 9 starts, latest over 5f here; good chance back at 6f
runners.spotlight: Good strike-rate since off the mark last February, winning four of her last nine starts at 5f and 6f; often leads but was ridden more patiently for recent 5f win over Second Collection and those tactics should work well now returned to 6f; respected despite the penalty.

runners.name: Anglesey Lad
runners.comment: Two good turf runs at about 6f last spring; not far away in a better race here latest
runners.spotlight: Maiden with two good 6f runs on turf for previous yard last spring; not yet back to that level for new stable but he wasn't far away in a better 5f race here last time; makes some appeal back at 6f down in class.

stable_tour.quote: He ran really well last week at Brighton when he was unlucky not to win. The first-time blinkers helped him in the first part of the race more than anything as he wasn't getting into gear in enough time. He's well handicapped off his mark of 54 as he's a 65-rated horse on his day. He's been second on three of his last four starts and is unlucky not to have won by now, but he'll have his day. Five furlongs is too short for him and going up to 6f on a galloping track will suit him better. He may head to Carlisle on Friday and he'll be winning pretty soon. 30-05-24

runners.name: Coco Hill

prev_owners.owner: Mrs T Burns And B R Millman

runners.comment: Two handicap wins as 2yo; rarely shone since but promising for new in-form yard latest
runners.spotlight: Two handicap wins as a 2yo; has rarely flared into life since but she ran her best race for a while when a close fifth in a similar C&D race on debut for new in-form yard this month; neither weights nor draw favour her today but she could be on the verge of a turnaround.

runners.name: Devilwala
runners.comment: Had form in much better races than this before absence but not yet back on track
runners.spotlight: Had wins and form in much better races than this before his absence but he's not yet back on track and was well held in a recent C&D race.

quotes.race: Deepbridge Innovative Investing Handicap
quotes.quote: Devilwala handled the ground and we went wide the whole way. Tim [Easterby] said I wasn't to hit this horse as he looked like he was going to win at Ayr last time but finished second - Jason Hart, jockey.

quotes.race: Darley Dewhurst Stakes (Group 1)
quotes.quote: That was a nice surprise. Devilwala might come back for the Craven next year - Ralph Beckett, trainer.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now EBF Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: Devilwala is a lovely horse. There's room for improvement as he was a bit green, but he showed a lovely attitude. When the second horse came to me, he pulled out more and was hardly blowing afterwards. I've got a lot of time for him and he has a bright future - Rossa Ryan, jockey.

runners.name: Gypsy Nation
runners.comment: Maiden who's tried various trips; close up over C&D latest; cheekpieces return
runners.spotlight: Maiden; has tried various trips either side of an absence that ended in January, failing to hang on to his lead in a recent C&D classified; had a go in headgear in 2023, cheekpieces refitted; needs more for the win.

runners.name: May Remain
runners.comment: Two course wins in 2023; harder to place now but lost out only late over C&D 12 days ago
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner whose two wins on this track came over 6f and 5f in 2023; harder to place these days but he gave best only late on over C&D 12 days ago and a lean spell may be on the verge of ending.

quotes.race: Winter Series Awards At Dundalk Stadium Handicap
quotes.quote: May Remain is a horse that likes to get on with things. He just idled a small bit in front having been there so long, but he did it well - Gavin Ryan, rider

quotes.race: Matchbook Betting Exchange Novice Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: May Remain is a nice horse. Mr Cole said he would benefit from his previous runs. I thought he had him spot-on for today. The ground was a bit lively for him, but he did everything right. He's got plenty of speed and he doesn't need to step up in distance - Jamie Spencer, jockey.

runners.name: Miss Billie
runners.owner: David Tate Danny Lawson Michael Wigham
runners.comment: Good 2nd in similar race at Southwell in February; less effective since; widest draw
runners.spotlight: Maiden; useful effort at the weights when a close second in 6f classified at Southwell in February (first-time blinkers) but she hasn't been seen to best advantage when front-running since; hard to predict tactics from widest draw.

runners.name: Sea The Buckthorn
runners.comment: Sole win over 7f here last January; out of luck at that trip since; first attempt at 6f
runners.spotlight: Sole win over 7f here last January but out of luck at that trip since and he was a long way back at Southwell this month; up against it on these terms now attempting 6f for the first time.

runners.name: Second Collection
runners.comment: Two C&D wins but mostly runs over 5f now; creditable 2nd in similar C&D race in February
runners.spotlight: Two C&D wins back in the day but last six successes over 5f; rarely attempts 6f now but she made a good fist of it in a similar C&D contest in February; not entirely dismissed despite the double-figure draw.

runners.name: The Cola Kid
runners.comment: Latest three wins in 2023; retained ability last year but not yet recaptured best in 2025
runners.spotlight: Latest three wins in 2023; he retained ability last year but his season ended early and he's still some way off recapturing best form in three runs since, including a 7f classified here 16 days ago.

quotes.race: Summer Racing At Naas Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: We thought he would need the run. He was a bit sick after the run the last day (tenth at Fairyhouse at the end of May) and I'd say he's probably better fresh. He stayed at it well. There is a race for him at Fairyhouse next Sunday, a six furlong 0-70 handicap. He's a good fun horse, very honest and stays going. Every time he ran up to now there was a problem with the draw but today everything worked to plan - Michael Brown, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Formerly with Michael Browne, he is another who joined us in September. It took us a while to get his head in front, but he did win at Newcastle (6f) in March and has run very well in defeat in each of his last two runs. I have given him a little break since then, but he is still on a competitive mark. 04-05-22

runners.name: Tommytwohoots
runners.breeder: D & S L Tanker Transport Ltd

prev_owners.owner: D & S L Tanker Transport Limited

runners.comment: Wide-margin turf win in October; on the premises at Newcastle this winter; possibilities
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner who came well clear on turf (6f) in October; on the premises at Newcastle since and had excuses for latest two runs at this level (cheekpieces refitted latest, now discarded); possibilities.

runners.name: Ustath
runners.comment: Little between him and May Remain on C&D form 12 days ago; B Loughnane up this time
runners.spotlight: Well into the slippers stage but he's won at least once every year since 2019 and remains capable at the right level; showed plenty of fight when close behind May Remain over C&D last time; can figure with Billy Loughnane up for only the second time.

quotes.race: Follow @thirskraces On Twitter For Ticketing News Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Ustath has not shown anything on turf but he ran last week at Catterick over five and wasn't quick enough, so we said that we would put him on a flat track over six and let him bowl. He enjoyed it and dug deeply - Ben Sanderson, jockey.

quotes.race: Heed Your Hunch At Betway Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Ustath did it quite well. He bounced out, travelled great and found plenty - Tyler Heard, jockey.

2:20.race_name: Boost Your Acca At BetMGM Handicap

runners.name: Infantry Officer
runners.comment: Emphatic win on handicap debut here (1m4f) ten days ago; major player back down in trip
runners.spotlight: Found stacks of improvement upped to 1m4f on handicap debut when justifying favouritism with 4l win here on his recent return (first run since gelded); now drops back in trip but he travelled smoothly last time and he's a major player under a penalty.

runners.name: Jester Queen
runners.comment: Still early days but she needs to do much better back up in trip; hood removed; new yard
runners.spotlight: Well held in her three qualifying runs and finished last of eight on handicap debut here (7f) in January; sold out of Jamie Osborne's yard for 2,000gns since; still early days but she went in snatches after a slow start last time and others are preferred; hood removed.

runners.name: Hawkesbury Legend
runners.comment: Been gelded and now goes handicapping but he needs a transformation upped in trip
runners.spotlight: Beaten 10l or more in his three runs this winter including when last of nine in a Kempton maiden (1m; pulled hard) in January; gelded since and now goes handicapping but he needs a transformation upped in trip.

runners.name: Perfect Parole
runners.comment: Exposed filly with record of 1-11 and she looks weighted near best off this mark
runners.spotlight: Made her breakthrough over 8.6f here last month but she flopped at Kempton 11 days later and was only fourth of eight at Lingfield (1m2f; hung badly left) last time; record now stands at 1-11 and she looks weighted near best off this mark; cheekpieces back on.

runners.name: About Last Night
runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie Biraben & A Gilibert
runners.comment: Handicap newcomer but she needs plenty of improvement after 132 days off; visor on
runners.spotlight: Tailed off at big prices in three runs last year and last two were at this track (8.6f); this is more realistic on handicap debut but she still needs plenty of improvement after 132 days off; first-time visor.

runners.name: Baileys Value
runners.owner: Baileys Horse Feeds (F H Nash Ltd)
runners.comment: Has struggled in her four runs including a Kempton handicap; cheekepieces are now tried
runners.spotlight: Struggled in three novice events in the autumn and same story on handicap debut at Kempton (7f, Polytrack; 40-1) last month; cheekpieces are now tried and has lots to prove upped on trip on Tapeta debut.

runners.name: Evas Eyes
runners.comment: 0-11 but was a respectable third over C&D last time and she could be in the mix
runners.spotlight: 11-race maiden she ran respectably when third of seven over C&D (first-time visor) 12 days ago and she's unexposed at this trip; could be in the mix if he she can find a bit extra.

5:35.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Handicap (Div II)

runners.name: Limmortale

prev_owners.owner: Ms Ciara Doyle & M C Grassick

runners.comment: Came good for current stable at second attempt; major player under a penalty here
runners.spotlight: Built upon encouraging stable debut (over C&D) when winning 1m2f Lingfield classified in refitted cheekpieces on Monday, opening his account at the 18th attempt; has 5lb penalty on this handicap return but still needs to be taken very seriously in current mood.

runners.name: Evoluir
runners.comment: Won 7f classified here last month and returns after 1m handicap fourth at Newcastle
runners.spotlight: Won 7f classified here last month and returns after very respectable fourth in 1m Newcastle handicap a fortnight ago; still unexposed over this sort of trip and has each-way claims at least.

runners.name: Tactical Control
runners.comment: Has modest strike-rate but kept on well for third off today's career-low mark this month
runners.spotlight: Has modest 1-20 strike-rate but kept on well for third at Chelmsford (1m) this month and remains on a career-low mark; could have a say if aided by first-time blinkers.

runners.name: Ravenglass
runners.comment: Effectively 2lb lower than when close second in recent 7f handicap; this trip also suits
runners.spotlight: In good form over 7f here this month, winning a classified race before going close under a penalty in a handicap; effectively 2lb lower than last time and will be fine over the longer trip; respected.

runners.name: Boujee Gold
runners.comment: Can be competitive off current mark but has been rather inconsistent in recent months
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner who often misses the break and is usually dropped in; can be very competitive off her current mark but has been rather inconsistent in recent months.

runners.name: King Of The Dance

prev_owners.owner: HP Racing King Of The Dance

runners.comment: Ran okay here this month, after a break, and remains on a career-low mark
runners.spotlight: Yet to win for current stable but returned from break with satisfactory run in C&D classified ten days ago and can be dangerous off this career-low mark if that outing brought him on.

stable_tour.quote: He ran once last year when an encouraging third over 6f at Windsor. He had a few issues after that, hence why he didn't run again until last month when finishing in mid-division at Lingfield. He was ring rusty but has come on in leaps and bounds since and the plan will be for another novice to get a handicap mark - he could be a dark horse for later in the season. 03-08-22

runners.name: Making A Move
runners.comment: Close third in Newcastle classified in January but two very disappointing runs followed
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish maiden; close third in 1m Newcastle classified in January, his second start for Daragh Bourke, but two very disappointing runs in similar races have followed.

runners.name: Van Zant
runners.breeder: Willie Musson Racing Ltd & R D Musson

prev_owners.owner: Ged Martin Nick And Mrs R Carr

runners.comment: 7f winner in January but recent effort have been disappointing; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Won 7f Southwell classified in January and is also suited by this C&D but his recent efforts have been disappointing and his overall profile is not persuasive.

runners.name: Stoic Syd
runners.comment: Latest run was a step back in the right direction; cheekpieces may aid further progress
runners.spotlight: Generally disappointing since his two 1m wins in early 2024 but took good step back in right direction when fifth in C&D classified ten days ago and has possibilities today if boosted by the new cheekpieces.

runners.name: Liege
runners.comment: 14-race maiden who was soundly beaten in 7f Lingfield classified on latest outing
runners.spotlight: 14-race maiden who was soundly beaten in 7f Lingfield classified on latest outing in January; back up in trip with cheekpieces (worn for last two races) removed today; difficult to enthuse over.

4:25.race_name: Â£30 In Free Bets With BetUK Classified Stakes (Div II)

runners.name: Mashaan
runners.comment: Course winner; easy 7f success at Lingfield on Monday; 0-15 at 6f but still a key player
runners.spotlight: Back to winning ways in a low-grade 7f handicap here on Boxing Day; held his form since, bar one blip tried in headgear, and he turned in his best effort for some time when running away with a 7f handicap at Lingfield on Monday; 4lb penalty to deal with but in a lower grade; leading form claims but he is 0-15 at this trip.

stable_tour.quote: We got him from Richard Fahey as an 18-race maiden, but the change of scenery certainly did him some good as he won at the second time of asking and followed that up three weeks later at Chelmsford. Those were both on the all-weather, but he will be just as effective on the turf, especially with a bit of cut in the ground. He pings the gate like a greyhound, but last time out at Doncaster, back on turf, they had not watered, and it was good to firm which was no good to him. To bring out the best in him he needs some ease on a turning track. As for trip, I think he's at his best over 7f on a turning track like Chester, or alternatively a stiff 6f on a straight course. 04-05-22

runners.name: Balmy Breese
runners.comment: Longstanding maiden but his best runs for this yard have come over C&D; fast pace a plus
runners.spotlight: Currently 0-25 but he has shown winning potential at a low level, including when a close third of 11 behind Lion's Dream in a similar event here over C&D 12 days ago; did best of those held up on that occasion but he's drawn wide and isn't certain to be in the same form.

runners.name: Banana

prev_owners.owner: Scott Dixon Racing , M Mahony , L Bond

runners.comment: 44-race maiden; effective over C&D but needs to rebound from a poor run 12 days ago
runners.spotlight: Just pipped over C&D two weeks ago but she followed that with a disappointing effort behind Lion's Dream here three days later; now 0-44 and others are stronger for win purposes.

runners.name: Global Effort
runners.breeder: Irish National Stud Mare Syndicate II
runners.comment: Three course wins in the last 9 months; ran okay over 5f here latest; widest stall to defy
runners.spotlight: Three course wins in the last nine months and he wasn't beaten far, despite a wide trip, in a 5f classified event ten days ago; stall 11 no help today.

runners.name: Himawari
runners.comment: Inconsistent maiden; this is her level but others look more appealing for the win
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent maiden; ran respectably in two classified events here (5f and 6f) this year but others look more appealing for win purposes.

runners.name: Lions Dream
runners.comment: Ended losing run of 22 when asserting late in a similar race here 12 days ago; respected
runners.spotlight: Ended a losing run stretching back to his racecourse debut in July 2022 when asserting close home in a similar C&D event 12 days ago; dangerous with a repeat.

stable_tour.quote: He's owned by The Horse Watchers, who are a seriously smart bunch of lads who know everything there is to know about form. This one came from Richard Hughes and I think he has a lot more to offer. He has been a little disappointing but shows me plenty at home and needs to transfer that to the track. I don't think he felt that comfortable on the all-weather and I'm hoping he can get it together on the turf. 22-03-23

runners.name: Nordic Glory
runners.comment: C&D win this month before a lesser effort behind Lion's Dream latest; can rebound
runners.spotlight: He had been threatening prior to his C&D win three weeks ago; beaten favourite in the race won by Lion's Dream here 12 days ago; should make a bold bid.

quotes.race: Play Coral Racing-Super-Series For Free Handicap
quotes.quote: Nordic Glory was down in class and deserved to win. He just needed a bit of luck from a wide draw - Michael Attwater, trainer.

runners.name: Posh Maisie
runners.comment: Limited encouragement for current stable and she looks vulnerable once more
runners.spotlight: Limited encouragement for current stable and she looks vulnerable once more.

runners.name: Red Walls
runners.comment: C&D win in January; in and out since and likely to have other pace to deal with today
runners.spotlight: C&D win in January came in a handicap; mixed bag since but Sean Levey a rare booking for the stable and he's well up to making an impact at this level; easy lead unlikely though.

runners.name: Savalas
runners.comment: C&D win last November; patchy since but may find this being run to suit his hold-up style
runners.spotlight: Got up late to beat We're Reunited over C&D last November; not so good since but he was caught wide here last time and he should get a strong pace to aim at today; considered.

quotes.race: totesport.com Tangerine Trees Conditions Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Savalas is just so tough and to win three in a row is some effort. I believe he is an out-and-out five furlong horse, so he will be staying at this trip. I'm not sure where we'll go next with him, we'll just take him home and have a think about it - Kevin Ryan, trainer.

runners.name: Were Reunited
runners.comment: Collared late over C&D last November; had an excuse latest; other pace on show here
runners.spotlight: Pipped at the post by the reopposing Savalas here last November; caught wide on his return from 12 weeks off in a 5f classified event ten days ago; other pace to contend with.

2:35.race_name: N&L Franklin Developments Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.name: Saint Bibiana
runners.owner: The Posh Pundit Racing Club Limited
runners.comment: Makes chase debut after absence but with trainer enjoying an excellent month; respected
runners.spotlight: Won three in a row over hurdles last May/June (3m2f/3m1f, good) and soft ground perhaps unsuitable last August when last seen; makes chase debut after absence but with trainer enjoying an excellent month and with conditions set to suit; respected.

runners.name: Ultra Beat
runners.comment: Narrowly in front when unseating five out here ten days ago; could be a contender
runners.spotlight: 0-10 but ran well when third at Warwick (3m, good to soft) in December and heavy ground may not have suited at Chepstow next time; narrowly in front in a first-time visor (retained) when unseating five out here (3m2f, good to soft) ten days ago and he could be a contender granted a clear round.

runners.name: Catchim
runners.comment: Won maiden hurdle here; placed in points and could improve for the switch to fences
runners.spotlight: Won on rules debut here (2m4f, good) last June and soft ground may have been against him in Market Rasen novice in November; has has wind op since; placed in points and he's a possible improver now switched to fences for his handicap debut; interesting.

runners.name: Ghost Hunter
runners.comment: Returns from absence with new stable in fantastic form and could improve now chasing
runners.spotlight: Ran well in defeat for Warren Greatrex last spring in his first two handicap hurdles (2m4f/3m, heavy/good); absent since (wind op in interim) but returns with new stable in fantastic form (remains in same ownership) and this point runner-up could improve now chasing.

stable_tour.quote: He was there for a long way at Kempton last month but was in top gear in the closing stages and got a bit tired. I don't think I should have run him as he needs soft ground and a galloping track. He's a well-bred three-miler and this season is just about experience before we go over fences. He ticks all the boxes. 13-12-23

runners.name: Jar Du Desert
runners.comment: 0-9 in Britain and inconsistent but runner-up last time and might not be far away
runners.spotlight: Won over fences in France; inconsistent across his nine British races but he's run well in second on two of his last four starts (3m/2m5f, good/good to soft), most recently three weeks ago; might not be far away.

runners.name: Rostello

prev_owners.owner: Mrs D L Whateley & Dr R D P Newland

runners.comment: Two-time course winner who went close 2 starts ago but inconsistent & pulled up last time
runners.spotlight: Won over C&D (heavy) last April and went close at Catterick (3m1f, good to soft) in January; not ruled out but he's struggled more often than not on his last few starts and was pulled up at Wetherby last time.

runners.name: Martalmixjac
runners.breeder: Mrs L & Mr J Grandchamp Des Raux
runners.comment: Went very close over C&D last month despite a stumble after jumping two out; key player
runners.spotlight: Returned to form when second at Ludlow (2m4f, good to soft) in December and beaten a short head over this C&D (good to soft) last month; did well to get so close last time having stumbled after jumping two out, and he's unexposed at this sort of trip; key player off the same mark.

quotes.race: Re-Gen Waste Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Martalmix'jac hinted he's got ability many times. We've gone to the races on the back of good runs thinking, 'Today is the day', then he's put a stinker in. He seems to like it around here and has put it all together. It wasn't the strongest race, but you've still got to win them. He was going away at the line and this was probably his perfect trip. He's not one to be slogging around in the mud. He wants summer jumping, but he might be able to nick one before his season is out. He should go in again - Alex Edwards, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He's turned into a really consistent campaigner, having been a little nondescript to start with. He was quite a closed book in knowing what ground he preferred and even his ideal distance, but he's turned into a very consistent sort. We can place him where he can be most competitive and he keeps pulling it out of the bag in those handicap chases around 2m4f. 16-01-25

runners.name: Bravethewaves
runners.comment: 2-4 over fences; could do with jumping better but remains open to further improvement
runners.spotlight: Won at Catterick (2m3f, good to soft) in January and made it 2-4 over fences at Doncaster (2m4f, good) last month; he could do with jumping better but is open to further improvement in this sphere, and there's stamina in his pedigree so this new trip could suit; in calculations.

3:05.race_name: Golf And Gallop Package Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.name: Tommy Cullen
runners.comment: In top form at favourite course Doncaster; leading candidate if he's as good here
runners.spotlight: Won at Doncaster (2m, good) last month and close second of three there since (2m, good); won over an extended 2m3f over hurdles; he's a Doncaster specialist but has shown promise elsewhere and is a leading candidate if his good form continues on his first visit here.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Every Saturday Money Back Handicap Chase (Go North One Man Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Tommy Cullen is a very brave horse. He didn't like the course [Huntingdon] last time, the [soft] ground wasn't correct, but he loves Doncaster - Jane May, owner, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: At the start of the season I gave him his debut in a bumper at Worcester and he finished mid-division, but he has really grown up in the last three months and if I ran him in a bumper today he would win. After a good third on his hurdling debut he went to Doncaster last month where he won by 19 lengths over 2m3Â½f. He has been given an opening mark of 115 which I think is very workable and he should be followed in handicaps. Although a little below par at Doncaster on Tuesday, he's probably suited by nicer ground than he got on the day. 11-01-23

runners.name: Quick Sharpener
runners.comment: Pulled up on two of his three chase starts but good second at Newcastle in between
runners.spotlight: Pulled up on two of his three chase starts, including latest, so comes with risks attached; however, in between he was a good second at Newcastle (2m4f, good to soft) and he enters calculations on that form.

quotes.race: William Hill Lengthen ~Yourodds Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We thought Quick Sharpener may have had a wind issue but we couldn't find anything wrong with him so the next thing to do was drop him back in trip as we wondered if he didn't stay - he looks like a three-miler and maybe he'd fooled us. He'll be a chaser, jumping is his best asset and that helped him out today - Dan Abraham, Foxtrot Racing.

runners.name: Salley Gardens
runners.comment: Mixed fortunes in short previous stint over fences in summer 2022 but he's not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Made mistakes during short previous stint over fences in summer 2022, and pulled up on last run in this sphere; however, he won over C&D (good) that June and has shown some good form over hurdles this season (not seen to best effect over 3m on heavy latest); not ruled out now back chasing.

quotes.race: Try Racing TV For Free Now Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Salley Gardens is on an upward curve and did that nicely. He loved the ground and Katie gave him a lovely ride - Olly Murphy, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He has done wonderfully well this season, winning three of his four races, the most recent at Fakenham in November. During that period his mark rose from 90 to 111, but he is still on the upgrade and should continue to do well. He is enjoying a midwinter break now but will be back in the spring and is another I am looking forward to sending out for novice chases. 26-01-22

runners.name: Stringtoyourbow
runners.owner: Gillman Int Plywood St Quinton S-Daniel
runners.comment: Two wins at end of last year & today's return to better ground could be just what he needs
runners.spotlight: Won two in a row at the end of last year (3m/2m4f, good/good to soft); soft ground perhaps hasn't been ideal the last twice but he was a fair third at Wetherby most recently and the return to a better surface today could be just what he needs.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Stringtoyourbow won at Ayr's Scottish Grand National meeting a few seasons ago and then got injured, but he's found his mojo again. Like footballers who can't score, they go through tough times, but he's now got plenty of confidence - Christian Williams, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Thistle Cabs Group Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Stringtoyourbow is a horse we like. He's been too keen in his maiden and novice hurdles but he's a nice horse going forward and I'll try to find something for him at Punchestown - Christian Williams, trainer.

runners.name: Bold Jury
runners.comment: Unseated early on first two chase starts and is a risky proposition at present
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 5yo who made the frame in points; ran out over hurdles in January; he's unseated early on his first two chase starts (latest at Market Rasen yesterday) and is a risky proposition at present.

runners.name: Tigerbythetail
runners.comment: Fair third at Huntingdon latest; not obviously well treated but could be involved
runners.spotlight: Off the mark under rules at the ninth attempt in Catterick maiden (3m1f, good to soft) last month; fair third of six back in a handicap at Huntingdon (3m1f, good to soft) ten days later and, while he's not obviously well treated, there's every chance he can be involved today.

runners.name: Feivel
runners.comment: On a handy mark on form as recent as November but he's been disappointing since
runners.spotlight: Two hurdle wins early last year and went close over fences at Fontwell in November; on a handy mark on that form and can't be totally dismissed, but this 10yo has been disappointing on his last three starts (hurdles/fences).

runners.name: Enjoy Dallen
runners.owner: The Ridgeway Racing For Fun Partnership
runners.comment: Very useful chaser in his prime; not the force of old; may be best watched on stable debut
runners.spotlight: Very useful chaser in his prime; he's tumbled down the weights but this 11yo has struggled to get competitive over fences this winter and was sold out of Ciaran Murphy's yard for 6,500gns in February; winless since 2021, and 0-13 over hurdles, and may be best watched on stable debut.

quotes.race: www.thurlesraces.ie Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Enjoy D'Allen has the makings of a lovely horse, we've known that. He improved from the last day, confidence-wise more than anything. He really galloped to the line today. He impressed me. He hits a flat spot, maybe at the third or fourth last, but with more racing that won't happen. He'll be some horse at the end of the year. He seems to go on any ground. We'll keep him going as a novice - Ciaran Murphy, trainer

runners.name: Coastal Rock
runners.breeder: S A S Haras Des Rocs
runners.comment: 2-4 in handicaps; leading claims if handling the forecast better ground
runners.spotlight: Won at Uttoxeter (2m4f, soft) in November on second handicap start and bounced back from Taunton flop to win at Bangor (2m7f, soft) last month; leading claims if handling the forecast better ground (ran okay on good going on handicap debut).

stable_tour.quote: We like him. He showed his inexperience on his debut at Wincanton but he's all the better for that and another summer. We'll look at another bumper and then decide whether we stay in that division or kick on over hurdles. 04-10-23

runners.name: Rockadenn
runners.comment: Well handicapped on old form but soundly beaten on both starts this year, after absence
runners.spotlight: Well handicapped on his French/British form up to spring 2023 but soundly beaten on both starts this year, following a long absence; this 9yo needs to raise his game in first-time cheekpieces.

quotes.race: Dorset & Somerset Air Ambulance Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I didn't know what to expect from Rockadenn as he ran out the other week. He had a wind op just before Christmas as he couldn't breathe at all. We didn't know what to expect as he jumped free and ran off the other day. He's a bit of a lad but he's clearly got ability to do that. I'm really surprised by it and I thought the other horse would get tired. He's not entered at Cheltenham but there's a nice handicap we might go to on Midlands National day and something like that could be realistic. He could mix and match chasing too - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We acquired him from Paul Nicholls' yard last spring and he's pretty useful. He was a very good second in a handicap hurdle at Haydock over 2m3f in December before we raised him significantly in class for a Grade 2 back there last month. He revels in getting his toe in and is as versatile over fences as he is over hurdles, so we'll be scanning the French programme book to find some suitable races for him this spring, as the prize-money there is so good. The key for him is very soft ground. 21-02-22

4:05.race_name: Grace & Dotty Fedora's And Feathers Maiden Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Qualifier) (GBB)

runners.name: Dunskay
runners.breeder: Mme Sarah Faulks & Mr Nigel Faulks
runners.comment: Two-time bumper winner; fair third on second hurdle start and open to further improvement
runners.spotlight: Two-time bumper winner (good to soft/soft) who was a fair third at Warwick (2m, good) this month on his second hurdle start; further improvement is needed today but that's possible; could be involved.

quotes.race: PHP Architects Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was an impressive show form Dunskay who had a dirty trachea wash after his last run. That was a good performance under a penalty and he'll go for the Aintree Bumper after that - Ben Pauling, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He came back in with a wind issue so we've had to rectify that and he won't be seen until Christmas time. The only time he got beat in bumpers was when he had a dirty trach wash after the race and I think he's a big talent. He's an exceptional jumper and a chaser for the future, but he's also effective over hurdles and I'm looking forward to getting him on the track. 21-11-24

runners.name: House Of Habsburg
runners.comment: Third in a point; didn't run badly on recent hurdle debut but needs sizeable step forward
runners.spotlight: Has a useful pedigree and he was a fair third of five on debut in an Irish point last February; didn't run badly when ninth of 11 on recent hurdle debut at Warwick (2m, good) but needs a sizeable step forward here.

runners.name: Kaboul Manhattan
runners.comment: Pulled up at 150-1 on last month's debut in maiden hurdle at Huntingdon
runners.spotlight: Pulled up at 150-1 on last month's debut in maiden hurdle at Huntingdon (2m, good to soft); transformation needed now in cheekpieces.

runners.name: Koapey
runners.breeder: S C E A Haras Du Hoguenet
runners.comment: Runner-up on all three starts and holds stand-out form claims today
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in a bumper and on both hurdle starts, all at about 2m on good to soft ground; has bumped into useful sorts the last twice and holds stand-out form claims today.

stable_tour.quote: He's a big, raw and weak horse who ran well in his bumper in October. The first time over hurdles, Harry Cobden loved him and he finished second to a smart horse called The Kemble Brewery. At Newbury last time we made plenty of use of him and he ran well. From the last to the line he probably weakened and he'll have one more run this season. He'll be very smart when he goes chasing. 05-03-25

runners.name: Luwdvig
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De Lonray
runners.owner: The Ridgeway Racing For Fun Partnership
runners.comment: Made the frame in two bumpers & may have needed the run on hurdle debut; not ruled out e-w
runners.spotlight: Made the frame in two bumpers last spring (good/soft); well beaten at 40-1 on this month's hurdle debut at Doncaster (2m3f, good to soft) but may have needed the run and is not ruled out each-way.

runners.name: Secret Vino
runners.comment: Well beaten at 66-1 on debut last July and probably best watched on first run since
runners.spotlight: Dam was a hurdle/chase winner but he was well beaten at 66-1 on debut in Worcester bumper last July; probably best watched on first run since.

runners.name: Tommy Tucker
runners.comment: Massive odds and yet to complete in three runs over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Massive odds and yet to complete in three runs over hurdles.
