runners.name: Wind Your Neck In
runners.comment: Useful on the Flat at his best but tailed off on recent hurdle debut at Newcastle
runners.spotlight: Three-time Flat winner who was useful at his best in that code; however, well beaten in two AW runs last month and tailed off on recent hurdle debut at Newcastle (2m1f, good); has plenty to prove.

runners.name: Carrigeen Ardisia
runners.comment: Soundly beaten on both starts and others are preferred
runners.spotlight: Down the field in Newcastle bumper and also soundly beaten on hurdle debut at Catterick three weeks ago; others are preferred.

runners.name: Saviour
runners.breeder: Irish National Stud Mare Syndicate III
runners.comment: Fair third at Doncaster on second hurdle start and he's an each-way contender
runners.spotlight: Fair maiden on the Flat who bumped into two useful fellow 4yos when 17l third at Doncaster (2m, good to soft) in December on second hurdle start; the hood is now left off; each-way contender.

5:10.race_name: Join Southwell Golf Club Handicap Hurdle (Div I)

runners.name: Shant Wait
runners.comment: Well beaten on handicap debut but sent off just 3-1 and shouldn't be written off
runners.spotlight: Kept on for encouraging fourth at Newbury (2m, soft) in January and was then sent off at just 3-1 for his handicap debut at Doncaster (2m5f, good); finished well beaten but this 5yo shouldn't be written off.

runners.name: Klapton Boy
runners.comment: Placed on both hurdle starts and latest form reads well; has potential off opening mark
runners.spotlight: Has shown ability in a point and at Wetherby (2m3f, good/soft) on both hurdle starts, finishing third most recently; that latest performance reads well and he has potential off his opening mark.

runners.name: Scorsese
runners.comment: Won easily at Sedgefield last week and he's ahead of the handicapper under a 7lb penalty
runners.spotlight: Suited by the drop back in trip and the return to a left-handed track when winning easily at Sedgefield (2m4f, good) last Thursday; he's ahead of the handicapper under a 7lb penalty and could play a leading role once more.

runners.name: Flighttothestars
runners.owner: M White M Beesley S Horsfall
runners.comment: Has shown ability but pulled up this year in her first two handicaps
runners.spotlight: Fair third in novice hurdle at Stratford last June but pulled up this year in her first two handicaps and a major turnaround is required.

runners.name: Sailed Away
runners.comment: Returned from another break with fair fourth three weeks ago and could build on that run
runners.spotlight: Consistent sort who was returning from another break when fair fourth at Market Rasen (2m4f, good to soft) three weeks ago; could improve for that outing and he's a possible contender.

quotes.race: Follow Us On X @betrhino Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Sailed Away has been beaten by the odd horse who is better handicapped than him, but he's very consistent and it's great for him to get his head in front. His only mistake was three out but he tends to do that now and again. He earned his win today - Stuart Edmunds, trainer.

runners.name: Kap De Triomphe
runners.breeder: P Mehat & B Mehat & C Lemeunier
runners.comment: Recent fifth at Taunton was step back in the right direction but he needs another today
runners.spotlight: Irish bumper winner who took a step back in the right direction when 10l fifth of seven at Taunton (2m3f, good) this month on his third handicap start; needs to build on that performance today.

runners.name: Ivane
runners.breeder: E A R L Trinquet & M & O Trinquet
runners.owner: A Keaveney, M Keaveney & P Butcher
runners.comment: Went close on recent stable debut at Fontwell and runs before 5lb rise kicks in
runners.spotlight: Just one win from his 25 starts but went close on stable debut at Fontwell (2m5f, good) ten days ago; runs before a 5lb rise kicks in and he could have more to offer for his up-and-coming trainer.

runners.name: Larkfield Lusive
runners.comment: 0-17 but third in this last year off a higher mark and he holds each-way claims
runners.spotlight: 0-17 but he's dropped down the weights since finishing third in this last year and was a fair third of 13 at Hexham (2m, good to soft) a fortnight ago; the step back up in trip could suit; each-way claims.

runners.name: Rock On Tommy
runners.comment: 10yo who is without a win since July 2023 but has run some fair races this season
runners.spotlight: 10yo who is without a win since July 2023 but he's produced some fair performances over 2m in the past 12 months and there can be hope he'll be okay now back up in distance; each-way possibilities

runners.name: Missy Mole
runners.comment: Good ground may help but she's achieved little over hurdles and is hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in a point on good going last April and she's yet to tackle such ground in a handicap; the forecast conditions offer a glimmer of hope but she's achieved little over hurdles and isn't easy to fancy.

3:35.race_name: Download The Racecourse App Raceday Ready Mares' Standard NH Flat Race (Cond'/Am') (C1) (GBB)

runners.name: Good Buy Dolly
runners.breeder: E A R L Arnaud Vasselin
runners.comment: She's struggled on her first two starts, the latest at Hereford yesterday
runners.spotlight: With a respected trainer but she's struggled on her first two starts, the latest at Hereford yesterday.

runners.name: Harleys Pride
runners.comment: Encouraging fourth of seven on debut at Punchestown and the form has worked out well
runners.spotlight: Fared beat of the newcomers when fourth of seven on debut at Punchestown (2m, good to yielding) last October and that form has worked out well; could be a contender on stable debut.

runners.name: Harmony Heights
runners.owner: M Songer, C Bailey & M Dodd
runners.comment: Fair fourth on bumper debut; lesser run on heavy ground since; not discounted
runners.spotlight: Made the frame in both points and fair fourth on bumper debut at Uttoxeter (2m, good to soft) in December; well beaten at Chepstow since but on heavy going; not discounted now back on better ground.

runners.name: Miss The Sting
runners.comment: First foal; dam bumper/2m hurdle winner (RPR 126); not ruled out on debut
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam bumper/2m hurdle winner (RPR 126), out of bumper/hurdle winner; yard, while not known for bumper winners, is having a good season and she's not ruled out on debut.

runners.name: Miss Tinkerbell
runners.comment: Fair fourth on debut at Wincanton and she's open to improvement; a possible
runners.spotlight: 10-1 when 12l fourth of eight on debut at Wincanton (1m7f, heavy) in January, for which she wore blinkers (no headgear today); from a family her trainer has done well with and she's open to improvement; a possible.

runners.name: Misty Sunrise
runners.comment: 58,000euros 3yo; dam Flat winner; in good hands; could play a leading role on debut
runners.spotlight: 58,000euros 3yo; first foal; dam 1m2f AW winner (RPR 79), half-sister to Early Morning Rain (bumper and useful hurdle winner); in good hands and could play a leading role on debut.

runners.name: Rightofway
runners.comment: Promising fourth on debut in November 2023 but then absent until heavy defeat last month
runners.spotlight: Promising fourth on debut at Warwick (2m, soft) in November 2023; may have needed her only run since, back at Warwick (2m, soft) last month, but she's not easy to fancy following that heavy defeat.

runners.name: Rock Sensation
runners.comment: Point runner-up; merely mid-division in sole bumper but could be capable of much better
runners.spotlight: Failed to settle when mid-division on bumper debut at Uttoxeter (2m, good to soft) in December; however, this point runner-up was sent off favourite at Uttoxeter and could be capable of considerably better.

stable_tour.quote: Our first horse in training with Ben Pauling, she's a big filly who did exceptionally well to finish second in her point-to-point, conceding 5lb to the winner. She's still growing and will be a really exciting mare with another summer, but she could very much win a bumper. 24-10-24

runners.name: Scarlett Glance
runners.comment: Tailed off at massive odds on both starts
runners.spotlight: Tailed off at massive odds on both starts.

runners.name: Scavengers Reign
runners.comment: Third in a point and a bumper and with a good yard to progress; chance
runners.spotlight: Third in Irish mares' maiden point (3m, good to yielding) in October and also showed promise when filling the same position in Newcastle bumper in January (2m, AW; 3-1); with a good yard to progress; chance.

runners.name: Service Minimum
runners.comment: Placed in strong bumpers on first two starts and holds leading claims
runners.spotlight: Third on debut in strong race at Uttoxeter (2m, good to soft) in October and runner-up at Ludlow (2m, good to soft) in December, behind one who has followed up; holds leading claims this afternoon.

stable_tour.quote: She ran well at Uttoxeter first time and should improve from that in bumpers, but she's definitely a jumper down the line. 12-11-24

5:40.race_name: Join Southwell Golf Club Handicap Hurdle (Div II)

runners.name: Tramuntana
runners.comment: Won on handicap debut at Huntingdon and a 5lb rise may not stop this unexposed 6yo
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner who won when upped in trip on last month's handicap debut at Huntingdon (2m3f, good to soft); this unexposed 6yo is in good hands to continue to progress and a 5lb rise may not stop him today.

quotes.race: Advertise Your Business At Huntingdon Racecourse Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Tramuntana had been a bit keen in his races so we decided to drop him in. It wasn't much of a race but he'll make a lovely chaser one day - Olly Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: Save Our Sport Sign The Petition "Newcomers" National Hunt Flat Race (Cat 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Tramuntana had been going well at home and is well bred so that was no surprise. He enjoyed himself out there and it was the perfect introduction - Fergus Gregory, rider.

runners.name: Teds Friend
runners.comment: Well treated on the pick of this season's form but well beaten on his last three starts
runners.spotlight: Made the frame four times in a row in September-January this season and well treated on the pick of that form; drying ground may help but he's been well beaten on his last three starts and needs to turn things around.

quotes.race: Ann Hitchings Memorial Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Ted's Friend probably got there a bit soon. He travelled so well into it and he's done it well, with a bit in hand. The further he's gone the better he went - Max Kendrick, jockey.

runners.name: Pottersjetamay
runners.comment: 0-10 but fair fifth at Doncaster last time and drops back down in grade today
runners.spotlight: 0-10 but runner-up over C&D (good to soft) in December and bounced back from lesser run on soft ground with fair fifth at Doncaster (2m5f, good) this month; drops back down in grade here and may not be far away.

runners.name: Barleythorpe
runners.comment: Improvement needed but the hood and longer trip are possible positives on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Hasn't achieved much in bumpers and novice/maiden hurdles (2m), and improvement is needed off his opening mark; however, his dam won at up to 2m4f and the first-time hood could help him settle now up in trip; not ruled out, and the betting may be informative.

runners.name: Our Pink Lady
runners.comment: Two C&D wins last March and went close at Huntingdon a fortnight ago; player
runners.spotlight: Two C&D wins (soft) last March and, having dropped back down the weights, she returned to form when going close at Huntingdon (2m3f, good) a fortnight ago; every chance she'll be bang there once more.

stable_tour.quote: She was bought from Ireland and was overrated by the handicapper when she first came, which I think is the case with quite a few lower-grade Irish horses. She's now dropped to a mark of 95, so she can get into a Class 5 and I'm sure she'll be very competitive at that level. She travelled well at Ludlow but didn't quite get home on the rain-softened ground. She'll be dropped in trip and probably go to Catterick just before Christmas. 06-12-23

runners.name: My Dream
runners.comment: Has shown ability here but pulled up over C&D ten days ago on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Fair fifth in C&D maiden last June but well beaten in C&D novice (good to soft) this month after absence, and pulled up over C&D (good to soft) on handicap debut ten days ago; plenty to prove.

runners.name: Faded Fantasy
runners.comment: Went close over fences in November but has struggled to get competitive subsequently
runners.spotlight: He's 10lb lower than when going close over fences at Hereford in November but has struggled to get competitive subsequently, over hurdles on his last four starts; 1-23 in this sphere and has to raise his game.

runners.name: Jumble Jury
runners.comment: Point winner; has a lowly opening mark but has shown very little over hurdles thus far
runners.spotlight: Point winner who goes handicapping off a lowly mark and shouldn't be written off, but he's shown very little on his three hurdle starts and improvement is necessary.

runners.name: Macmolly
runners.comment: Pulled up on handicap debut last August but returns having had wind surgery
runners.spotlight: Hasn't shown much in her light career and pulled up on handicap debut at Fontwell (2m5f, good) last August when last seen; however, there's some potential in her pedigree and perhaps wind surgery will have done the trick.

runners.name: Noble Recall
runners.comment: Tailed off/pulled up on all five starts; hard to fancy on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Tailed off/pulled up on all five starts; has basement mark for this first handicap start but is hard to fancy nevertheless.

4:32.race_name: eventmasters.co.uk Challenger Staying Chase Series Final Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.name: The Doyen Chief
runners.comment: Only his fourth run over fences when doing it comfortably at Kempton; raised 5lb
runners.spotlight: Admirably consistent gelding who didn't have too much trouble in justifying a shade of odds-on at Kempton 12 days ago (3m, good); 5lb rise is perfectly fair for one who was having only his fourth run over fences; should progress some more.

stable_tour.quote: He's a horse we like. We haven't over-raced him but he's won a bumper and a couple of hurdle races. He's an Irish point-to-point winner and we'd been happy with his schooling before his chase debut at Market Rasen, where he made a pleasing start in third. We've generally kept him to right-handed tracks because he's shown a tendency to go a bit to his right, but I hope he'll be more adaptable down the line. 25-10-24

He's a horse we like, an Irish point-to-point winner who's been successful since in a bumper and a couple of hurdle races. We were happy with his schooling before his chasing debut at Market Rasen and he made a pleasing start in third. We've generally kept him to right-handed tracks because he's shown a tendency to go a bit to his right but I hope he'll be more adaptable down the line. 07-11-24

runners.name: Sail Away
runners.breeder: S A R L Phoenix Eventing
runners.owner: Mr And Mrs J D Cotton
runners.comment: Approaching his time of year and ran best race for a while when third at Kempton latest
runners.spotlight: Tends to come good around this time of year and ran his best race for a while when only 4l off The Doyen Chief at Kempton; bled from the nose there but that's rare for him and he should run very well.

quotes.race: CPMS Novices' Champion Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We won this three years ago with Molly The Dolly and we've had it in mind we wanted to come back for it with Sail Away. I had him entered for the Scottish National but that may be next year. He loves nice ground, his jumping counted for a lot and he was a fresh horse. He'll probably go for the Summer Cup at Uttoxeter unless the ground is particularly quick - Dan Skelton, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's won some decent races but he had a crashing fall at Newbury last week, having shown plenty of enthusiasm beforehand. His chances will come when the handicapper gives him a break, over two and a half to three miles on decent ground. 12-11-24

runners.name: Ballycamus
runners.comment: Has more on his plate than when winning at Ludlow but overall profile is appealing
runners.spotlight: Mostly consistent since sent over fences (4-11) but he has gone up 5lb for his 3m win at Ludlow (good to soft) when a lot went wrong for his five rivals; he was also partnered by a 3lb claimer then, so appears to have more on his plate now; still rates a likely contender given overall profile.

runners.name: Snipe
runners.comment: Struggled at Ascot but in a strong race and previous efforts bring him right into this
runners.spotlight: Not at his best last time at Ascot but that was a competitive Class 1 handicap and his previous placed efforts included a near miss behind the subsequent Welsh National winner; commands respect at this level and he tries cheekpieces for the first time.

quotes.race: William Hill Epic Boost Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Snipe is going the right way and could be one for marathon distances in the spring - Dan Skelton, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's run well on two trips to Carlisle this season, probably not staying the three and a quarter miles last time in quite a competitive race. There are definitely three-mile chases to be won with him. 12-11-24

runners.name: Peejaybee
runners.breeder: Scea Ecurie Brindor & Scea Du Claux
runners.comment: Never travelled last time but he has a big run in him if back on song
runners.spotlight: Very capable chaser on his day and pushed an improver close at Market Rasen on his penultimate start (3m, good to soft); reportedly never travelling when pulled up back there last time; has a big run in him if back on song.

quotes.race: Racing TV Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was pleasing from Peejaybe and he'll come on for it. I thought the trip was probably going to be a bit sharp for him but he's done it well. I hope this will be a stepping stone to another novice somewhere and we'll see how we go - Richard Spencer, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He goes for the Challenger Staying Chase Series final at Warwick on Thursday. He qualified for it when second at Market Rasen in January. He wasn't right after the last meeting, he was a little bit sore and had a cough but if he gets up to Warwick fresh and well he'll run nicely. 26-03-25

runners.name: Stans The Man
runners.comment: Dropped his guard the last twice and he's accustomed to lower-grade races than this
runners.spotlight: Won 3m/3m2f handicap chases in November on good ground but has dropped his guard the last twice and he's accustomed to lower-grade races than this.

3:57.race_name: Weatherbys & Northampton Town FC Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Chief Sunday
runners.comment: Hat-trick bid came up shy at Ludlow but the winner benefited from a bold ride
runners.spotlight: Progressive 5yo who ran well in defeat at Ludlow when bidding for a hat-trick (2m, good to soft), beating all bar one who got loose on the lead; up another 3lb but brings solid credentials.

runners.name: Holeshot
runners.comment: Back from a break to make a lot of the running at Taunton and the form has been franked
runners.spotlight: Back from a break to make a lot of the running at Taunton (2m3f, good to soft) and win by 7l; raised 10lb but he did have last week's Newbury winner Mahler Moon back in third.

runners.name: Caramelo Rapido
runners.comment: Might be on a tough mark for this first handicap but kept on for a fair fourth at Carlisle
runners.spotlight: Might be on a tough mark for this first handicap but he kept on for fourth at Carlisle (2m1f, good to soft) last month and it's still early days; hard to rule out.

runners.name: Whats One More
runners.comment: Beaten favourite last time but drops back in distance here and she retains potential
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner; quite eyecatching when beaten 4l in her first handicap (2m, good to soft) and raced too freely off the pace when beaten further at Fontwell (2m3f); drops back in distance here and she retains potential.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Mares' Open Maiden National Hunt Flat Race (Category 3 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: What's One More ran well to be third first time but did everything wrong last time. That was more like it and I got her settled early before she came with a good run in the straight. I had the fancied horses around me which is encouraging - Tom Bellamy, jockey.

runners.name: Denzil
runners.comment: Very weak in the betting when tailed off on his handicap debut at Doncaster
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in minor races here and at Taunton but he was very weak in the betting when tailed off on his handicap debut at Doncaster (2m, good to soft; 28-1); only 2lb lower here.

3:27.race_name: Celebrating 15 Years Of JRFB Novices' Handicap Chase

runners.name: Glimpse Of Glory
runners.comment: Close third on his chase debut but he did look a hard ride in the first-time blinkers
runners.spotlight: Only his seventh career start when a close third on his chase debut at Ludlow (2m, good to soft) where he looked a hard ride in the first-time blinkers before emerging on the scene; remains to be seen whether he builds on that; this longer trip shouldn't be an issue.

runners.name: Micro Millions
runners.comment: Beaten 14l and about 10l in his last two races and needs extra
runners.spotlight: Winning pointer; ten defeats under rules divided between hurdles and fences; beaten 14l and about 10l in his last two races and needs extra.

stable_tour.quote: He was third on his debut for us in a maiden hurdle. He needed the run and will need a step up in trip at some point but he should make a nice novice hurdler this season before going chasing. 21-11-23

runners.name: Ceolwulf
runners.comment: Had subsequent winner Yes And Yes behind when second to a Pipe improver at Leicester
runners.spotlight: Had subsequent winner Yes And Yes behind when second to a Pipe improver at Leicester (2m4f, soft; has form on good) where he wore first-time cheekpieces after a long absence; won't be far away if he can hold his form.

runners.name: Yes And Yes
runners.owner: David W Jagger & Mrs Belinda Clarke
runners.comment: Appreciated the good ground when a convincing winner at Chepstow; penalised
runners.spotlight: Perhaps needed the run at Leicester after 350 days away and reportedly appreciated the good ground when quite a convincing winner at Chepstow (2m3f, good) 11 days ago; has a penalty but that might not stop him if he performs to the same level.

runners.name: Zmiinyi
runners.comment: Second in November so the ability is there should he be all the better for a break
runners.spotlight: Improved form when second on his chase debut at Market Rasen (2m5f, good; first-time tongue-tie) earlier this season but two lesser runs followed; the ability is there should he be all the better for a break.

runners.name: Jack Sparrow Grey
runners.breeder: S A R L Mm Stud
runners.comment: Minor hurdle form and looks best watched on chase debut with cheekpieces given a go
runners.spotlight: Best efforts were in bumpers and hasn't shown much at all over hurdles, including here two months ago on handicap debut (2m3f); looks best watched on chase debut with cheekpieces given a go.

runners.name: King Of The Hill
runners.comment: Has placed form in this discipline but has been absent since pulling up last June
runners.spotlight: 0-11 overall and 0-8 as a chaser; does have placed form in this discipline but has been absent since pulling up last June, so hard to be confident about him.

2:27.race_name: Join Racing TV Now Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.name: Aviation
runners.comment: Hard to fault until pulling up at Sandown and that was in the competitive EBF Final
runners.spotlight: Runner-up over C&D in December and probably similar form when running well on two visits to Fakenham; pulled up at Sandown but that was in the competitive EBF Final and perhaps found the ground too soft.

stable_tour.quote: He's been pretty consistent to be fair to him, winning once and finishing in the first three on his other runs this winter until a couple of weeks ago in the EBF Final at Sandown. They had watered and the ground there was quite tacky, and he also made an uncharacteristic error at the first and I think that unsettled him a bit. He was then stuck wide all the way. You need it all to go right in those races and nothing did go right for him. It didn't pan out and Tom Cannon wisely pulled him up. I think we can put a line through that run. I'm hoping he'll have one more outing before the end of the season and he'll definitely be going chasing. 19-03-25

runners.name: Ebony Warrior
runners.owner: Dl Adams, Ja Adams & G Mcpherson
runners.comment: Consistent; solid chance in this company if resuming where he left off in November
runners.spotlight: Consistent last year, showing his best form when runner-up in a valuable series final at Worcester in September (2m4f, soft; fine on good); excellent claims in this company if resuming where he left off in November.

runners.name: Chuggy
runners.breeder: R D & Mrs J S Chugg
runners.comment: Hereford third was quite remote; has to improve, though that's perfectly feasible
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to the stable's Cheltenham hero The New Lion; pulled up in his only point and modest form when a 13l third on hurdling debut at Hereford (2m3f, good); has to improve, though that's perfectly feasible.

runners.name: Tuscany
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs W O D Tilley
runners.comment: Has shown ability but needs to raise his game to trouble the best of these
runners.spotlight: There have been glimmers of promise in his three races (2m-2m5f) but he needs to raise his game to trouble the best of these.

runners.name: Velvet Vulcan
runners.comment: Won only one of his 20 Flat starts, a 1m4f classified race on the AW 13 months ago
runners.spotlight: Won only one of his 20 Flat starts, a 1m4f classified race on the AW 13 months ago; ran moderately at that same level when last seen; had wind surgery ahead of this hurdling debut but makes very limited appeal.

quotes.race: BetUK. Home Of The Acca Classified Stakes
quotes.quote: We're very happy for owner-breeder Richard Marriott and his broodmare Battery Power. Velvet Vulcan is now the fourth winner from the mare from four runners - Michael Keady, joint-trainer.

2:57.race_name: Tony Darby Retirement Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Honey Jack
runners.comment: Improved form for the win and made a noise last time; now has a tongue-tie fitted
runners.spotlight: Clearcut winner of his second handicap start (3m, good to soft) and a tongue-tie is now added after reportedly making a noise back at Taunton last time; 6lb higher than for his win but firmly enters the reckoning.

runners.name: The Dark Edge
runners.comment: Plumpton winner; below par the last twice and stamina for quite this far isn't proven
runners.spotlight: Plumpton winner in September and has shown that he can deal with this 10lb higher mark; however, hasn't shown any benefit for cheekpieces the last twice and stamina for quite this far isn't proven.

runners.name: Seasmoke
runners.comment: Good run last time but there are some stamina doubts over this longer distance
runners.spotlight: Won at Market Rasen (2m5f, good) last May off 6lb lower; her second run back from a break was better than the first, going down by 2l at Stratford (2m6f) under a positive ride; there are some stamina doubts over this longer distance.

quotes.race: Mick And Linda Jackson Mares' Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Seasmoke showed today she had a gutsy attitude and the family has multiple winners because of that. James [Bowen, jockey] gave her a well judged ride and he said if he rode her again then he'd go that little bit quicker - Billy Aprahamian, trainer.

runners.name: Victory Club
runners.comment: Struggled in handicaps and last week at Huntingdon finished tailed off on his chase debut
runners.spotlight: Twice placed in maiden hurdles but struggled in handicaps and last week at Huntingdon finished tailed off on his chase debut; has tried various aids that are now removed; others preferred.

runners.name: Lyness Dancer
runners.comment: More competitive on recent handicap debut when beaten under 8l at Fontwell (3m2f)
runners.spotlight: Hadn't shown a lot but was more competitive on recent handicap debut when beaten under 8l at Fontwell (3m2f, good to soft); that's something to build on.

runners.name: De Vegas Warrior
runners.breeder: Dubois Holdings Ltd & Lope De Vega Synd
runners.comment: Running well when crashing out two from home at Taunton 17 days ago
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden under both codes but he was running well when crashing out two from home at Taunton 17 days ago (3m, good); enters the reckoning.

runners.name: Just Four Fame
runners.comment: Continues to fall in the weights but he's had a few chances now in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Continues to fall in the weights but he's had a few chances now in handicaps and is not progressing.

runners.name: Newtonian
runners.comment: Should have run better only 19 days ago at Hereford when back on good ground
runners.spotlight: Only win came on good ground off 2lb higher here last May (3m1f); has run well since then but form has taken a turn for the worse this year and should have run better only 19 days ago at Hereford when back on good ground.

stable_tour.quote: There aren't many opportunities for him at the moment. He'll be in again in a 0-110 at Hereford over 3m2f - he must have 3m-plus to be at his best. He's put together two really good runs in a row and wasn't beaten far at Huntingdon last time. He wouldn't want it very heavy and he wouldn't want it very quick, but he seems in particularly good form at the moment. 28-11-24

runners.name: One Man Party
runners.comment: Runner-up two starts back but then finished tailed off at Hereford; now 0-15
runners.spotlight: Maiden who ran his best race when second of six at Fakenham (3m, good) two starts ago but failed to build on that when tailed off at Hereford (3m1f); on balance he has a lot to prove.

runners.name: Lizzie Rey
runners.comment: Escapes a penalty for her recent 3m win at Southwell when in new cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Escapes a penalty for recent 3m win at Southwell (good to soft), which was her first run in cheekpieces and the second after wind surgery; clearly a strong contender if she's as good again.

runners.name: Luna Run
runners.comment: 0-9 but there are races in her off this mark and good ground could be ideal
runners.spotlight: Beaten in the region of 10l in two handicaps (3m1f/2m7f; good to soft) since the tongue-tie was added, last time finishing fourth of 17 at Chepstow; perhaps her best run came on good ground when second in a 3m handicap last May; off since November but can run well.

runners.name: The Last Melon
runners.comment: No worthwhile form over fences and hurdles since returning from a long absence
runners.spotlight: No worthwhile form over fences and hurdles since returning from a long absence; a 13yo now.

5:05.race_name: Visit racingtv.com 'Newcomers' National Hunt Flat Race (GBB Race)

runners.name: Hey Buddy
runners.comment: 42,000euros 3yo; fourth foal; closely related to 2m hurdle winner Marshella
runners.spotlight: 42,000euros 3yo; fourth foal; closely related to 2m hurdle winner Marshella; dam unraced sister to 7f winner Mission Approved and half-sister to smart bumper/2m hurdle winner Cinders And Ashes; one of two runners for a yard that wins plenty of bumpers.

runners.name: Imalrightwithme
runners.comment: Second foal; dam maiden hurdler and sister to two successful jumpers
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam maiden hurdler, sister to winners Leave At Dawn (useful 2m-2m6f hurdle) and Present Lodger (2m4f chase); the market should be useful with his yard doubly represented.

runners.name: Not At That Price
runners.comment: Brother to the smart bumper/hurdle winner Let It Rain; stable gets bumper winners
runners.spotlight: Seventh foal; brother to the smart bumper/hurdle winner Let It Rain; dam AW bumper winner and sister to top-class bumper and 2m4f-3m hurdle/chase winner Whisper; stable gets bumper winners.

runners.name: Our Bobby Dazzler
runners.comment: Fifth foal; half-brother to 2m4f-3m hurdle/chase winner My Bobby Dazzler
runners.spotlight: Fifth foal; half-brother to 2m4f-3m hurdle/chase winner My Bobby Dazzler; dam point winner, half-brother to useful winners Mister Matt (2m/2m1f chase) and Douglas Julian (2m4f-2m7f hurdle/chase); stable has had bumper winners but 0-15 in this scene this season.

runners.name: Pioneer Pete
runners.comment: First foal; dam point winner and half-sister to point winner Debacle
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam point winner and half-sister to point winner Debacle, out of 1m 2yo Flat and 2m-3m1f hurdle/chase winner; needs checking in the market.

runners.name: Java Jackie
runners.comment: Second foal out of a Flat (1m2f-1m4f) and hurdle winner; others appeal more on paper
runners.spotlight: Second foal out of a Flat (1m2f-1m4f) and hurdle winner; others appeal more on paper.

runners.name: Queens Ginger
runners.comment: First foal out of a bumper and 2m/2m4f hurdle winner
runners.spotlight: First foal out of a bumper and 2m/2m4f hurdle winner, and half-sister to winners Taradrewe (bumper and 2m3f-3m1f hurdle) and Horace Hazel (bumper and 2m7f-3m2f hurdle/chase); trainer 1-25 in bumpers the last five seasons.

runners.name: Shes A Woman
runners.comment: Second foal; dam 1m6f Flat (RPR 62) and 2m/2m1f hurdle winner
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam 1m6f Flat (RPR 62) and 2m/2m1f hurdle winner, half-sister to prolific 7f-2m winner Noguchi; watching brief makes sense on debut.

runners.name: Dutch Corner
runners.comment: 50,000euros foal; half-brother to high-class bumper/2m-2m7f hurdle/chase winner Yorkhill
runners.spotlight: 50,000euros foal; eighth foal; half-brother to high-class bumper and 2m-2m7f hurdle/chase winner Yorkhill; unraced dam closely related to smart 2m1f-3m1f hurdle/chase winner Offshore Account and useful 2m1f-3m hurdle/chase winner Dooneys Gate; the market should reveal plenty about expectations.

runners.name: Liam Mera Kai
runners.comment: Â£32,000 3yo; fifth foal; half-brother to French 5f 2yo winner Magic Dariya
runners.spotlight: Â£32,000 3yo; fifth foal; half-brother to French 5f 2yo winner Magic Dariya; dam placed in French 2m1f chase, half-sister to French 2m4f Listed hurdle winner Pour Dol; could be interesting.

runners.name: North Nestor
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs R Varmen & Richard Kent
runners.comment: The stable's four bumper winners this season have included newcomers
runners.spotlight: 11,000euros foal; first foal out of a bumper winner, out of unraced close relative of useful 2m hurdle winner Snake Eyes; stable's four bumper winners this season have included newcomers.

runners.name: Pic N Mix
runners.comment: Dam unraced half-sister to top-class hurdler Harchibald; the betting may be informative
runners.spotlight: 14,000euros 2yo; twelfth foal; half-brother to five winners including Champoleon (bumper/3m hurdle), Ange Blanc (bumper) and Robin Hill (French 2m1f hurdle); dam unraced half-sister to top-class hurdler Harchibald; the betting may be informative on debut.

runners.name: Answering
runners.comment: Maiden hurdle winner, latecomer to chasing, struggled at this venue on first attempt
runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdle winner on heavy ground at Thurles 12 months ago; latecomer to chasing, struggled at this venue on first attempt; held by On Lovers Walk on that running.

runners.name: Ask The Bookie
runners.comment: Has been regressive over hurdles, needs to bounce back from a dismal run two months ago
runners.spotlight: Has been regressive over hurdles, handicap mark now down to 100 from an original 109; no chasing experience and needs to bounce back from a dismal run at Naas two months ago.

runners.name: Ballybrittas
runners.comment: Point/hurdles winner, bright start to chasing career at Thurles, form boosted by winner
runners.spotlight: Won two point-to-points for Caroline McCaldin last season; winner of a maiden hurdle on good ground at Limerick in October on his second attempt; jumping was untidy at times when beaten 32l in sixth on handicap debut; made a bright start to chasing career when second to Spinning Web at Thurles; form boosted by winner in a handicap at the same venue.

runners.name: Luimneach
runners.comment: Two wins in handicap hurdles, fair form in the first half of the season, makes chase debut
runners.spotlight: Won twice over hurdles two seasons ago before a lengthy spell on the sidelines; fair form in the first half of the season; makes chase debut.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Luimneach is a grand horse. We were maybe a bit lucky at the last. He ran a cracker at Leopardstown when he pulled too hard, over the two miles here he did not pull as hard. He'll be a chaser in time - Des McDonogh, trainer

runners.name: On Lovers Walk
runners.comment: Some doubt about the quality of his jumping but has definite chance on his best chase form
runners.spotlight: Dual point winner; second in five of his nine races over hurdles; some doubt about the quality of his jumping but has definite chance on his best chase form, namely a head second in a beginners' at Down Royal in December; tended to jump to the right here six weeks ago.

runners.name: On The Tide
runners.comment: Modest form in six races over fences, pulled up in a handicap last time, up against it
runners.spotlight: Modest form in six races over fences; pulled up in a 3m handicap at Navan last time; up against it.

runners.name: Presenting Max
runners.comment: Never in the hunt over a longer trip on his chasing debut at Thurles, others preferred
runners.spotlight: Promise in a couple of his maiden hurdle starts, notably when 20l third behind the top-class Romeo Coolio at Down Royal; never in the hunt over a longer trip on his chasing debut at Thurles; others preferred.

runners.name: Pride Of Place
runners.comment: Promising handicap hurdle run on his penultimate start for Michael Hourigan, chase debut
runners.spotlight: Transferred form the now-retired Michael Hourigan to Enda Bolger; would have gone very close in a handicap hurdle at Naas in January last year but for a bad mistake at the last; might need this.

runners.name: Boghlone Honey

prev_owners.owner: Francis G Murray & John T Murray

runners.comment: Two handicap hurdle wins in 2022, twice well beaten since returning from long absence
runners.spotlight: Two handicap hurdle wins in 2022; twice well beaten over hurdles since returning from long absence, though ran in good company at Leopardstown; unseated at the first on only previous chase start.

runners.name: Dees Getaway
runners.comment: Tramore maiden hurdle over 2m5f, might find this trip inadequate on chasing debut
runners.spotlight: Tramore maiden hurdle winner over 2m5f; one of the younger horses and least-exposed in the field and has a decent pedigree; might find this trip inadequate on chasing debut.

runners.name: Eves Hope
runners.comment: 20-1 course winner of a maiden hurdle in December, ran in good company on chase debut
runners.spotlight: 20-1 course winner of a maiden hurdle in December; ran in good company on chase debut at Thurles 12 days ago; possibly capable of making her presence felt in this grade.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Eve's Hope idled when she hit the front and hopefully she can improve from that. There's a race for her at Limerick over Christmas next - Mark Quigley, trainer

runners.name: Flidais
runners.comment: 2-20 over hurdles, down the field in Thurles chase in which Ballybrittas was second
runners.spotlight: 2-20 over hurdles, placed five times; remote fifth over 2m4f at this venue on chasing debut; down the field in Thurles contest in which Ballybrittas was second.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Maiden Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Flidais is a really nice filly. She has speed and class and she will stay well. She will be aimed for Galway - John Ryan, trainer

runners.name: Ixigreczed
runners.breeder: S C E A De Maulepaire
runners.comment: Handicap hurdle winner last summer, struggled at Thurles on first chase start
runners.spotlight: Winner of a 2m3f handicap hurdle at Kilbeggan last July off a modest 90; struggled at Thurles three weeks ago on first chase start.

runners.name: Ta Na La

prev_owners.owner: John Clarke & Brian McBride & Neal Clarke

runners.comment: Sole win over hurdles was gained over 2m4f on good ground, may need this after a break
runners.spotlight: Maiden winner over an extended 2m4f on good ground at Bellewstown last July; would probably prefer better ground and may need this after a break; no chasing experience.

runners.name: Kaikoura
runners.breeder: M Philippe Thiriet, S A R L Charel Bloodstock & M Vincent Le
runners.comment: A distant second in a maiden hurdle at Limerick in November, chase debut; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; best run so far when staying on for a distant second in a 2m2f maiden hurdle at Limerick in November; chase debut.

runners.name: Karacole
runners.comment: Placed five times over hurdles, given a break after a poor run in November; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; former French-trained Flat winner; placed five times over hurdles, including on both starts at this track; given a break after a poor run at Navan in November; of some interest, bearing in mind her 109 hurdles rating.

runners.name: Ernie From Nurney
runners.comment: Two handicap hurdle wins, has run with promise in handicaps over fences; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; has two handicap hurdle wins to his name; has run with promise in handicaps over fences, admittedly off a lower mark than his hurdles rating.

quotes.race: Owners Insurance Included In AIRO Membership Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Ernie From Nurney is a massive big horse and he is just maturing. He is starting to put runs together. We will keep going in those low graded races and maybe pick up a chase - Padraig Roche, trainer.

runners.name: Backmersackme
runners.comment: Chasing debutant, point and bumper winner, rated 127 over timber, watch the market
runners.spotlight: Chasing debutant; point-to-point and bumper winner; 0-8 over hurdles but has shown a decent level of ability and rated 127 in that sphere; dam a half-sister to Grade 1 winning chaser Jessies Dream; cheekpieces worn on latest discarded; watch the market.

runners.name: Dancingondaceiling
runners.comment: 121 rated hurdler, fell chase debut, jumped right latest, track should suit, place chance
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner is 2-3 over hurdles and rated 121; fell three out on chase debut at Gowran but much better on latest when fourth of 15 in a beginners at Navan (2m4f, soft), 2.75l behind Western Fold despite jumping right; this track should suit better; place claims.

runners.name: Fromquintotulla
runners.comment: Maiden pointer, well beaten in a bumper, best watched on chase debut
runners.spotlight: Maiden pointer finished well beaten in a bumper in his sole start under Rules; best watched on chase debut.

runners.name: Killaney King
runners.comment: Point winner, 0-6 over hurdles and rated 122, will be well schooled for chase debut
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner; 0-6 and rated 122 over hurdles but has finished runner up on three occasions; beaten a head on latest in a Gowran handicap hurdle off 117; will be well schooled for this chasing debut and he can't be discounted.

stable_tour.quote: He appears to be a lovely young horse and he's been working well of late. We'll hopefully get him started in a maiden hurdle over the next few weeks. 20-11-23

runners.name: Lombron
runners.comment: Rated 126 over hurdles, fine efforts in first two beginners' chases, the one to beat
runners.spotlight: One of two for yard; maiden hurdle winner is 1-6 in that sphere and rated 126; beaten 9.25l by Lecky Watson on chase debut in a strong beginners' chase at Naas in December; built on that with a 4.25l second behind Harry Des Ongrais at Gowran last month; the one to beat.

quotes.race: Sign Up To GavinLynchRacing.com Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Lombron was very straightforward and settled well, His jumping put him back into the race throughout. He lengthened nicely and picked up again from the last. He will come on for that and has a lot of natural ability - Paul Townend, rider

runners.name: Maidenstreetprince
runners.comment: 1-8 over hurdles, 0-6 over fences and rated 125, vulnerable to less exposed rivals
runners.spotlight: 1-8 over hurdles and rated 123; 0-6 over fences and has a chase rating of 125; has an experience edge but probably vulnerable to some less exposed rivals; others appeal more.

quotes.race: Keith Lynch Memorial Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Maidenstreetprince had a good run the last day and was getting a few pounds today. He was a bit free and there is room for improvement in his jumping. He stuck it out well. We'll see what the handicapper does - Charles Byrnes, trainer.

runners.name: Mighty Jeremy
runners.comment: Chasing debutant, 3-19 over hurdles, new yard, may need this run and softer ground, watch
runners.spotlight: 3-19 over hurdles (including a win here) for Liam O'Brien, achieving a rating of 114; now makes his chasing debut for Pat Foley after a 330 day break and the hood returns; entitled to need the run and may want it softer; watch.

runners.name: Rath Gaul Boy

prev_owners.owner: Sullivan Bloodstock Limited & Neill Hughes & P Crowley

runners.comment: Point, bumper and hurdle winner rated 135 over timber, come on for chase debut, claims
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; point-to-point, bumper and hurdle winner; rated 135 over timber; should come on for his chasing debut at Punchestown (2m, soft) last month after a 296 day break and the step up in trip here should suit; preferred by Townend; claims.

quotes.race: Leopardstown Members Flat Race
quotes.quote: That was a nice performance from Rath Gaul Boy. I didn't think he had that much speed given his pedigree, but he has more than he is bred for. He's a fabulous jumper and he will go hurdling next season - Willie Mullins, trainer.

runners.name: Rockbrook
runners.comment: Mudlark is 3-14 over hurdles and rated 112, well beaten over C&D on chase debut, oppose
runners.spotlight: Mudlark who is 3-14 over hurdles and rated 112; well beaten over C&D in a beginners' on chase debut when sent off at 20-1; others appeal more.

runners.name: Tumuch
runners.comment: Point winner, huge odds for both chase starts and never figured, may need more time
runners.spotlight: One of two for yard; point-to-point winner; 0-3 over hurdles and rated 113; huge odds and beaten a long way in two chase starts; may need more time.

stable_tour.quote: Looked smart when winning his point and he's definitely better than he showed in a bumper on bottomless ground at Gowran Park 28-10-24

runners.name: Western Fold
runners.comment: Two-time hurdles winner, 0-4 over fences and rated 134, held by Lombron on Gowran form
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; two-time hurdles winner; 0-4 over fences but has shown ability and rated 134; finished 2.25l ahead of Dancingondaceiling last time at Naas but previously well held by Lombron at Gowran; each-way claims at best.

quotes.race: Franciscan Well Rated Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Western Fold was keen with me two runs back and I rode him to get settled today. He did it well and will get further - Jack Kennedy, rider

runners.name: Lady Bresil
runners.comment: 1-4 over hurdles and rated 108, huge odds and struggled on chase debut, up against it
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; 108 rated hurdler is 1-4 in that sphere; sent off at 100-1 for her chase debut at Gowran and struggled to land a blow; looks up against it in this company.

runners.name: Tupelo Mississippi

prev_owners.owner: Brian Ellison Racing Club & G Preston

runners.comment: Five wins for Brian Ellison including a handicap chase, pulled up in a recent point
runners.spotlight: Winner of two bumpers (in 2020) and three races over jumps for Brian Ellison, the most recent in a 2m5f handicap chase at Cartmel last summer, pulled up in a point-to-point at Kildorrery on first start for Ian O'Connor; best watched.

runners.name: Beau Walking
runners.comment: Modest chase form, faced tough task from 10lb out of the handicap at Punchestown last time
runners.spotlight: Placed five times over hurdles; modest chase form, though now takes a big drop in class having contested Punchestown's Grand National Trial from 10lb out of the handicap.

runners.name: Baldurs Gate
runners.comment: 1-16 record over fences is a concern, fair placed form, cheekpieces now, each-way prospect
runners.spotlight: 1-16 record over fences is a concern but placed eight times; fair form this term, including when third behind today's rival One Horse Army over 3m2f at Fairyhouse; stays well and seemed to find 2m4f inadequate at Gowran last time; first time with cheekpieces; place prospect.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes "We Play Together" Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Baldur's Gate got a great spin from James, the horse just needed the 7lb off over the trip. He's just had a few niggly problems but we always thought he was a nice horse, He's a gent of a horse. We'll find something over Christmas - Denise O'Shea, trainer.

runners.name: Harveys Quay
runners.comment: Navan fourth was encouraging, confidence may have been dented by a fall at Leopardstown
runners.spotlight: Had failed to complete three times in a row before a much-improved display when fourth at Navan last month; any confidence regained then may have been dented by a first-fence fall at Leopardstown.

quotes.race: Powerstown Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Harvey's Quay got a very easy lead in a very bad race. I was only hacking in front and nothing came near me. Hopefully he can keep progressing - Mark Walsh, rider.

runners.name: Maciver
runners.comment: Bids for a five-timer here, has gone up two stone for three chases wins, respected
runners.spotlight: Made it four in a row (including a handicap hurdle win) when landing a Limerick event two weeks ago; began his sequence off a lowly 78, now promoted to 106; breakthrough came with a 25l win, has scored by a short head (over C&D) and a neck on his last two starts; tough sort, likely to be in the mix again.

quotes.race: Copper Coast Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Maciver was sharpened up by the cheekpieces. He was very lethargic last time, he jumped well and stayed well - Phillip Enright, rider.

runners.name: One Horse Army
runners.comment: Won at Navan and Fairyhouse in January, up an aggregate 19lb, unplaced at Leopardstown
runners.spotlight: Won at Navan and Fairyhouse within eight days in January, defying 10lb rise on second occasion, with Baldur's Gate back in third; got another 9lb for that and finished out of the money at Leopardstown.

quotes.race: Early Bird For Easter Festival @Fairyhouse Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: One Horse Army just gallops and stays. Soft ground and a trip is what he wants - Paudie Roche, trainer.

runners.name: Bite That
runners.owner: Mrs Patrick J Flynn & Gavin Omahoney
runners.comment: Reeled off four seconds in a row before 8l Wexford win, could go well off 8lb higher
runners.spotlight: Hurdles winner; achieved a sequence of four seconds in handicap chases last October/November; went one better with an emphatic 8l win at Wexford ten days ago; could go well over longer trip off 8lb higher.

runners.name: Jump The Shark
runners.comment: Downpatrick winner last spring; lame on next start, jumped poorly at Fairyhouse on return
runners.spotlight: Ran only twice in 2024; justified support in a handicap chase over just short of 3m on good ground at Downpatrick in May; jumped badly and afterward reported lame behind when beaten favourite at Punchestown the following month; jumped poorly and pulled up at Fairyhouse in January on return.

quotes.race: Joe Rea Memorial Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Better ground really helps Jump The Shark and he just travels better on it. Hopefully he can kick on from this, he was knocking on the door over hurdles. Hopefully he might go in again - Keith Donoghue, jockey.

runners.name: Doonbeg Don
runners.comment: Has potential for further progress as a chaser to back up Galway win and Down Royal second
runners.spotlight: Winning chase debut in 2m6f Galway handicap (soft) in October; moderate hurdles run at Punchestown in December; much better back over fences when second at Down Royal in January; has potential for further progress as a chaser.

runners.name: Pebble Bleu
runners.comment: Punchestown win last autumn came on good ground, fourth off lower hurdles mark on latest
runners.spotlight: Won a handicap chase over this trip at Punchestown last autumn on good ground; set some stiff tasks after in search of black type; disappointing back hurdling at Punchestown in January, but ground was probably too testing; beaten 10l in fourth off her lower hurdles mark at Thurles 12 days ago.

runners.name: Robyndeglory
runners.comment: On a long losing run over hurdles, poor at this venue on latest after good Punchestown run
runners.spotlight: Five wins over hurdles, no success since February 2023; took a step back in the right direction when fourth of 12 in a mares' handicap hurdle at Punchestown early last month; failed to reproduce that form at this venue four weeks ago; placed in a small-field chase here in 2023.

runners.name: Iks Man
runners.comment: Beaten 22l in sixth behind Maciver at Limerick two weeks ago, unlikely to turn the tables
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner and placed twice over hurdles; yet to find his level over fences; unseated halfway at Limerick early in the month; beaten 22l in sixth behind Maciver at the same venue last time; unlikely to turn the tables.

runners.name: Emily In Paris
runners.comment: Decent form as a hurdler/chaser before a break, prefers good ground but on a fair mark
runners.spotlight: Off since November after a consistent spell, mixing between hurdling and chasing; handicap chase form has featured second at Killarney and Punchestown; can be competitive off this mark but prefers good ground.

quotes.race: Lighthouse At Clifford Electrical Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Emily In Paris was well in this evening. She's not a bad filly and she's out of a mare who won over a mile-and-a-half on the Flat - Davy Fitzgerald, trainer

runners.name: Walkonthebriteside
runners.comment: Won a 3m hurdle at Wexford last August, veterinary excuse at the same venue on chase debut
runners.spotlight: Won a 3m hurdle at Wexford last August; sent off favourite on chase debut at the same venue later that month; veterinary excuse emerged (blew hard and coughed post-race); returns from a break.

runners.name: Ask Mike
runners.comment: 1-7 in points, unplaced in three hunter chase outings, needs to jump better; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; 1-7 in points; came home alone when scoring at Borris House in December 2023; unplaced in three hunter chase outings; needs to jump better than when fifth of seven finishers at Thurles three weeks ago.

runners.name: Game And Glory
runners.comment: Better hurdler than chaser, pulled up at Limerick on Sunday; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; 2-27 over hurdles; 0-10 over fences and rated 10lb lower in this discipline; hard to be confident after her failure to complete at Limerick on Sunday; on the positive side, she ran well over hurdles at Leopardstown early in the month.

runners.name: Getaway King
runners.comment: Point winner, has struggled on the track, set very ambitious task on latest; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; point-to-point winner; poor racecourse form, though admittedly his bid in a Grade 3 race at Navan last time was highly ambitious.

runners.name: Amberjack
runners.comment: Never figured in a pair of Limerick bumpers; well down the pecking order on hurdling bow
runners.spotlight: Never figured on bumper debut at Limerick's Christmas meeting; similar story at the same venue two weeks ago; well down the pecking order on hurdling bow.

runners.name: Be Positive
runners.comment: Good eighth at Leopardstown latest, beaten 11l; JJ Slevin takes over; could improve again
runners.spotlight: Poor on debut at Fairyhouse but went with a bit more zest when eighth of 18 (2m, yielding) at Leopardstown, beaten 11l; JJ Slevin takes over; could improve again.

runners.name: Captain P
runners.comment: Won a point at Tyrella in January; rules debut for Cheltenham Festival-winning trainer
runners.spotlight: Seventh foal; 12,000euros 3yo; won third maiden point-to-point start at Tyrella in January; makes rules debut for Cheltenham Festival-winning trainer; can figure.

runners.name: Dreams Of West
runners.comment: Dam unraced half-sister to Captain Chris; belated debut for small yard; best watched
runners.spotlight: Tenth foal; half-brother to several winners; dam unraced half-sister to high-class 2m-2m5f jumps winner Captain Chris; belated debut for small yard; best watched.

runners.name: Glenmore River
runners.comment: Each-way chance for yard responsible for Cheltenham Hunters' Chase winner Wonderwall
runners.spotlight: Remote fifth-placed finishes when sent off at big prices at Clonmel and Punchestown; the form of both races has worked out well; each-way possibilities for yard responsible for Cheltenham Hunters' Chase winner Wonderwall.

runners.name: Howdoyalikeherhome
runners.comment: 0-9 under rules & 0-4 in points for Patrick Foley; market can guide on 1st run for Elliott
runners.spotlight: Seventh foal; 12,500euros buy; 0-9 under rules and 0-4 in point-to-points for Patrick Foley; market will guide on first start for Gordon Elliott.

runners.name: Kotkito Bello
runners.breeder: M Remi Bouchet & M Bruno Mazure
runners.comment: 95,000euros 3yo; dam half-sister to Espanito Bello; unplaced in three point-to-points
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; 95,000euros 3yo; half-brother to French 15.5f winner Inside Bello; dam half-sister to smart 2m3f-3m hurdle/chase winner Espanito Bello; unplaced in three point-to-points; first run for stable having fine season.

runners.name: Mikey Maloo
runners.comment: First foal; dam unplaced bumpers, 1m1f-1m6f Flat and 2m2f hurdle; hard to fancy on debut
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam unplaced bumpers, 1m1f-1m6f Flat and 2m2f hurdle, half-sister to bumper winner Slipeneer; hard to fancy on debut.

runners.name: Pour One More
runners.comment: Third to Champion Bumper runner-up Heads Up on debut; entitled to respect on hurdles bow
runners.spotlight: Fair efforts in trio of bumpers this season, including a remote third behind subsequent Champion Bumper runner-up Heads Up on debut at Punchestown; entitled to respect on hurdles bow.

runners.name: Rockonliam
runners.comment: Poor when sent off joint-fav' at Tramore; stable in better form now so better expected
runners.spotlight: Sharing the lead and there with a chance when falling at the last at Lismore on sole point-to-point start last season; disappointed when sent off joint-favourite for rules debut at Tramore; stable in better form now so better expected; tongue-tied.

runners.name: Tackletommywoowoo
runners.comment: Modest late headway when remote seventh of 20 on stable debut at Gowran; more needed
runners.spotlight: Couple of good efforts in British bumpers when trained by Sam Drinkwater; modest late headway when remote seventh of 20 on stable debut at Gowran 19 days ago; more needed.

runners.name: Tom Sarah Evelyn
runners.comment: Placed in two summer bumpers for Tom Gibney in 2021; two poor efforts since returning
runners.spotlight: Placed in two summer bumpers for Tom Gibney in 2021; not seen again until pulled up in Kilbeggan maiden hurdle last autumn on first run for this yard; made no impression when a faller two out here in January.

runners.name: Tsavo Park
runners.comment: One-time 110,000euros purchase is 0-4 in point-to-points and will need more time
runners.spotlight: Second foal; 110,000euros 3yo; 19,000euros Goresbridge Nov 24; dam 2m hurdle winner, out of half-sister to Champion Hurdle winner Make A Stand; 0-4 in point-to-points; will need more time.

runners.name: Koolio Kate
runners.comment: Beaten a long way in a pair of Thurles bumpers over a year apart; impossible to recommend
runners.spotlight: Beaten a long way in a pair of Thurles Christmas bumpers over a year apart; impossible to recommend; hooded.

runners.name: Wildfield Sky
runners.comment: Top rider booked for bumper debut at Thurles three weeks ago but ran no race whatsoever
runners.spotlight: Top rider booked for bumper debut at Thurles three weeks ago but she ran no race whatsoever; little to recommend.

runners.name: Crab Road
runners.comment: Dam out of unraced close relative of 1m2f-1m4f Group 1 winner Kutub; best watched though
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam unraced half-sister to Italian 6.7f-1m2f winner Faroujah, out of unraced close relative of 1m2f-1m4f Group 1 winner Kutub; best watched.

runners.name: Market Ready
runners.comment: Half-brother to bumper and smart 2m3f-3m1f hurdle/chase winner The Worlds End; needs time
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; 15,500euros buy; half-brother to bumper and smart 2m3f-3m1f hurdle/chase winner The Worlds End; likely to need more time.

runners.name: The Eggler
runners.comment: Half-brother to bumper/3m hurdle winner; stable 2-7 at Clonmel this season; check market
runners.spotlight: Second foal; half-brother to bumper/3m hurdle winner; dam out of maiden half-sister to smart 2m-3m hurdle/chase winner; stable 2-7 at Clonmel this season; worth a market check.

runners.name: Way Down We Go
runners.comment: Sent off at triple-figure odds when showing nothing in two outings to date; avoid; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; sent off at triple-figure odds when showing nothing in two outings to date; avoid.

runners.name: On The Cards
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Quesnay
runners.comment: Flat recruit still a maiden; no show in three starts for this yard; best watched; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; Flat recruit is still a maiden; no show in first three starts for this yard; best watched.

runners.name: Getaways Charm
runners.comment: 0-3 in point-to-points but interesting runner for top yard if she gets a run; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; 39,000euros 3yo; dam French 1m1f-1m4f winner, placed in 2m2f Listed hurdle; 0-3 in point-to-points but interesting runner for top yard if she gets a run.

4:45.race_name: Adare Manor Opportunity Mares Maiden Hurdle

runners.name: Mayo For Sam
runners.comment: Flat recruit must concede weight to the field; soft ground against her; tough ask
runners.spotlight: Flat recruit won two races in that sphere; remote midfield finish on hurdles bow at Naas in December; must concede weight to the field; soft ground against her; tough ask.

quotes.race: Get Galway Races Ready With tote.ie Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Mayo For Sam just can't seem to win in Mayo! A mile and two is probably her trip. We couldn't get her into Galway so we came here and it's after working out great. There's a lot of fun to be had with her and she'll jump a hurdle - Ado McGuiness, trainer.

runners.name: Ashdale Flyer
runners.comment: A repeat of January 2024 run will see her go close but has been off the track since August
runners.spotlight: Hasn't progressed in ten hurdle starts but was just denied in Punchestown maiden (20.5f, soft) in January 2024; a repeat of that will see her go close but she has been off the track since August.

runners.name: Ellies Rock
runners.comment: Half-sister to the talented Thunder Rock but she has shown little in four outings to date
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to the talented Thunder Rock but she has shown very little in four outings to date; stick a line through her.

runners.name: Finnicky Filly
runners.comment: Good fifth at Tipperary in November but failed to build on that promise when midfield here
runners.spotlight: Decent effort when fifth at Tipperary in November but failed to build on that promise when midfield here (16.5f) in December; the step up in trip needs to bring out improvement.

runners.name: Former Flame
runners.comment: Solid efforts in first three bumpers but has regressed since returning from a short break
runners.spotlight: Solid efforts in first three bumpers but has regressed since returning from a short break in January; jumped poorly when seventh on hurdles debut at Leopardstown this month.

runners.name: Knockaneleigh Girl
runners.comment: Will at least find this easier than the handicap she contested at this track on her return
runners.spotlight: Winning point-to-pointer is 0-7 over hurdles and will need to improve appreciably to feature; will at least find this easier than the handicap she contested at this track on her return.

runners.name: Liscahane United
runners.comment: Weak bumper form; tailed off at Downpatrick on hurdling debut; lacks a recent run
runners.spotlight: Weak bumper form; tailed off at Downpatrick on hurdling debut; lacks a recent run; others preferred.

runners.name: Miss Penny Copper
runners.comment: Eyecatching Cork run; tailed off at Gowran; needs to bounce back on hurdles bow
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner; 12-1 and not disgraced in Cork mares' bumper (2m, yielding to soft) on her rules debut in January; completely tailed off a month later at Gowran; needs to bounce back on hurdles bow.

runners.name: Nashville Notions
runners.comment: Half-sister to 2m4f hurdle winner Find A Fortune; dam 2m hurdle/chase winner; best watched
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; half-sister to 2m4f hurdle winner Find A Fortune; dam 2m hurdle/chase winner, half-sister to useful 2m-2m4f hurdle/chase winner Whoshotthesheriff; 0-5 in point-to-points.

runners.name: Rachels Secret
runners.comment: Third to stablemate Custom Taylor at Limerick 2 weeks ago; handles soft; sets the standard
runners.spotlight: Promise for this stable last season, twice runner-up in maiden hurdles at Tramore; tailed off on sole outing for Henry de Bromhead in January; didn't see out 3m on first run back with this yard when third to stablemate Custom Taylor at Limerick two weeks ago; handles soft; sets the standard.

runners.name: Shannon Bank
runners.comment: Creditable efforts all five bumper starts; could get involved but stable 0-31 this season
runners.spotlight: Creditable efforts all five bumper starts, sandwiched between a couple of decent types when runner-up at Down Royal last March the pick of the efforts; has the form to get involved on hurdles bow but stable 0-31 this season.

runners.name: Thequeenof Spikle
runners.comment: Down the field in maiden hurdles last season and no impression in Thurles bumper on return
runners.spotlight: Down the field in maiden hurdles at Tramore and Tipperary last season; made no impression in Thurles bumper on return; difficult to recommend.

runners.name: Tolovelyoldmiltown
runners.comment: Third foal; dam point winner, sister to winners Archie Meade and Somethingprecious; hooded
runners.spotlight: Third foal; dam point winner, sister to winners Archie Meade (point and useful 2m-3m hurdle/chase) and Somethingprecious (point/2m6f hurdle); hooded; best watched.

runners.name: Daisy Ellie
runners.comment: Dam sister to several winners; one of 3 in the race for Queally so the market will guide
runners.spotlight: Third foal; 12,000euros 3yo; dam unraced sister to several winners; one of three in the contest for Declan Queally so the market should be informative.

runners.name: Sarahs Express
runners.comment: Dam out of half-sister to 2m3f-3m hurdle/chase winner Some Invitation; others more likely
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam bumper winner, out of bumper and 2m/2m4f hurdle winning half-sister to useful 2m3f-3m hurdle/chase winner Some Invitation; others more likely.

runners.name: Times In Oz
runners.comment: Flat recruit 0-5 in that sphere; finished last at Naas four days ago; readily passed over
runners.spotlight: Flat recruit 0-5 in that sphere and is rated a modest 58; finished last of 15 at Naas (6f) four days ago on first start for this yard; readily passed over on hurdles debut.

runners.name: Only A Dollar
runners.comment: Lost form since course win in May 2024, hopes pinned on return to this venue; hood returns
runners.spotlight: Won a mares' maiden hurdle here in May last year (2m, yielding); lost form since and pulled up at Fairyhouse when last seen in October; mark has slipped and hopes pinned on return to this venue and the reapplication of a hood sparking a revival; risky.

runners.name: Silent Dawn
runners.comment: 0-6 over timber, his Kilbeggan third would give him a chance, fell latest, risks attached
runners.spotlight: 0-6 over hurdles; best effort a 3l third at Kilbeggan in May 2024; no impact in four starts since and took a heavy fall at Thurles three weeks ago; his Kilbeggan effort would give him a chance off his current mark but he isn't one for maximum faith.

runners.name: Splendid Choice
runners.comment: 0-10 over hurdles, promise over C&D on stable debut, struggled in h'caps, needs more
runners.spotlight: One of two runners for yard; 0-10 over hurdles; didn't show much for Matthew Smith; promise over C&D on debut for Philip Rothwell in February of last year but has struggled in handicaps; needs more.

runners.name: Kilcrea Castle
runners.comment: Big odds and well beaten in five hurdles starts, tongue tie now tried, hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Long odds and ran accordingly in five starts over hurdles; no sign of improvement on handicap debut latest; tongue tie now added to cheekpieces; hard to make a case for.

runners.name: Beeverstown Place
runners.comment: Good effort here on penultimate and 3lb lower now, 3m too far latest, chance back in trip
runners.spotlight: 0-12 over hurdles but has run well in defeat; beaten 7.5l into fourth of 12 off 88 over 2m3f here on penultimate and is now 3lb lower; 3m may have stretched him last time; leading chance dropped back in trip.

runners.name: Hitthehayson
runners.comment: No impact in maidens or on handicap debut, may need more time
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; showed little in a trio of maiden hurdles at 2m-2m4f; similar story in first time cheekpieces when pulled up on handicap debut at Punchestown in January; may need more time.

runners.name: Esticky End
runners.comment: Flat winner, 0-6 over hurdles, pulled up on latest, needs the ground to dry out
runners.spotlight: Three-time Flat winner is 0-6 over hurdles; refused to race on his last start in that sphere at Dundalk; pulled up on return to hurdling at Punchestown last month, though heavy ground a valid excuse; needs the ground to dry out.

runners.name: Fanoir
runners.comment: C&D maiden winner in 2022, has struggled in handicaps, hard to fancy on recent form
runners.spotlight: 1-8 over hurdles, that win coming over C&D in April 2022 in a mares' maiden; lightly raced since and has struggled to make an impact in handicaps; assessor is giving her a chance and the return to this venue is a positive but she's hard to fancy on recent form.

runners.name: Ladyeze Man
runners.comment: 0-10 over timber, hasn't built on decent h'cap bow, beaten 38l here on latest, needs more
runners.spotlight: 0-10 over hurdles; best effort on handicap debut at Cork in October 2023; 5lb lower here but hasn't matched that in six runs since; beaten 38l here on latest over 2m3f; more needed.

runners.name: Connemara Shore
runners.comment: Handicap debutante, no promise in maidens but could improve, check the market
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutante; not much sign of ability in four maiden hurdles at 2m-2m4f but could improve for switch to handicap company; keep an eye on the market.

runners.name: Chemdawg
runners.comment: Flat winner, 0-9 over timber, beaten 29l off 3lb higher latest, hard to make a case for
runners.spotlight: Flat winner is 0-9 over hurdles; best effort in this sphere a 2.5l second of 15 off 84 at Bellewstown (2m1f, good) in August 2023; no sign of repeating that in recent runs; dropped 3lb for 29l defeat on latest; not easy to make a case for, even in this company.

runners.name: Volez Vous
runners.comment: Shock 2m winner here latest, up 7lb and up in trip, chance if repeats that last run
runners.spotlight: Shock 66-1 winner on heavy ground off 72 here last month over 2m; up 7lb and steps up in trip; trainer said a more positive ride brought about the improvement; a repeat of that would likely be enough to take this, though the ground will be a bit livelier here; chance.

runners.name: Surviving Murmansk
runners.comment: Dual-purpose maiden, 0-8 over hurdles, pulled up the last twice, lacks a run, watch
runners.spotlight: Long standing dual-purpose maiden; 0-8 over hurdles and pulled up on his last two starts in this sphere; lacks a run and is probably best watched.

runners.name: Kalanisi Dubh
runners.comment: Course winner over 2m off 6lb lower, may have needed latest, claims if gets in; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; 2-17 over hurdles including a win at this track over 2m on heavy in December 2023 off 92 and is 6lb higher now; may have needed her latest run at Gowran earlier this month where she wasn't disgraced; claims if she gets a run.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Seamus had Kalanisi Dubh in great form, she was very fresh and came on plenty from the last day. She was great and it's great to do it for a small owner and trainer. This is my first double and a huge day for me - Niall Moore, jockey.

runners.name: Star Official
runners.comment: Has won off 4lb lower, this trip might suit, chance on his run here in December; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; won off 95 at Thurles in October 2023 and is 4lb higher now; ran well here over 2m a couple of times since; looks well worth a try at this trip and a repeat of his run here in December would give him every chance.

runners.name: St Anthonys Corner
runners.comment: Lost form after debut win, signs of life two weeks ago, chance if builds on that; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; 50-1 winner on racecourse debut in a Ballinrobe maiden hurdle; her next six runs were poor but signs of life when fourth at Limerick two weeks ago and is a pound lower; place claims at least if building on that.

6:15.race_name: Next Race Meeting April 17th (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race

runners.name: Ace Brannigan
runners.comment: Headed close home in Ballindenisk point-to-point in December; respected for top yard
runners.spotlight: 48,000euros buy; half-brother to Sky Pirate and Captain Teague; dam bumper/2m5f hurdle winner; headed close home in Ballindenisk point-to-point in December; respected for top yard.

runners.name: Artsncrafts
runners.comment: Dam Group-placed 1m winner; stable 5-24 in bumpers this season; might want good ground
runners.spotlight: Dam Group-placed 1m winner (RPR 94), out of French Oaks winner; stable 5-24 in bumpers this season; withdrawn at Gowran on March 8 due to going (soft to heavy); might want good ground.

runners.name: Ballyredinkingston
runners.comment: Half-brother to several winners; dam bumper winner; 0-5 in points; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Seventh foal; 55,000euros 3yo; half-brother to several winners; dam bumper winner; 0-5 in point-to-points; stick a line through him.

runners.name: Cosmos Dainay
runners.breeder: E A R L Elevage D Ainay
runners.comment: Off the mark at the fourth attempt in a Borris House point before Â£165,000 sale; respected
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the fourth attempt in a Borris House point-to-point before Â£165,000 sale; form of that win knocked a bit since; may need more of a stamina test but respected nonetheless.

runners.name: Doctor Steinberg
runners.comment: Third behind top-class stablemate Kopek Des Bordes in Fairyhouse bumper last March
runners.spotlight: Cost 95,000euros at three; finished third behind top-class stablemate Kopek Des Bordes in Fairyhouse bumper last March, a race that has worked out incredibly well; absence of no concern given the stable.

runners.name: John Valjohn
runners.comment: Dam half-sister to Marine Nationale; could feature for Cheltenham Festival-winning trainer
runners.spotlight: Third foal; 52,000euros 3yo; dam bumper winner, half-sister to top-class bumper and 2m hurdle/chase winner Marine Nationale; could feature for Cheltenham Festival-winning trainer.

runners.name: Lion Of The Desert
runners.comment: Tailed off at Thurles three weeks ago; needs to take a giant leap forward to figure
runners.spotlight: Hooded on debut (retained) when tailed off at Thurles three weeks ago; needs to take a giant leap forward to figure.

runners.name: Minella Sergeant
runners.comment: Led for most of the way on stable/rules debut at Fairyhouse but weakened out of things
runners.spotlight: Poor efforts in point-to-points; led for most of the way on stable/rules debut at Fairyhouse last month but weakened out of things three out; hard to fancy at present.

runners.name: Saint Peregrine
runners.comment: Cheap purchase at 7,500euros; stable 0-14 in bumpers this season; others more likely
runners.spotlight: Cheap purchase at 7,500euros; fifth foal; dam unraced half-sister to two point-to-point winners; stable 0-14 in bumpers this season.

runners.name: Sunny South West
runners.comment: Never-nearer fifth of 18 at Thurles (good) three weeks ago; each-way chance for local yard
runners.spotlight: Pulled up on his sole point-to-point start but produced an eyecatching run on rules debut when a never-nearer fifth of 18 at Thurles (good) three weeks ago; each-way chance for local yard.

runners.name: Take Chance
runners.breeder: Mme Sigrid Moisson, Mme Alexandrine Berger, M Cesare Gallori
runners.comment: Cheap purchase was a remote second in Tinahely point-to-point in October; market can guide
runners.spotlight: 2,000euros yearling; brother to French 2m2f hurdle winner, half-brother to German 1m2f-12.5f winner; remote second in Tinahely point-to-point in October; market will guide.

runners.name: Butchers Daughter
runners.comment: Only hints of encouragement taken from two bumper efforts in December 2022; off since
runners.spotlight: Only hints of encouragement taken from two bumper efforts in December 2022 but has been off the track 817 days; would require a big leap of faith on first start for new yard.

runners.name: Crossbar Getaway
runners.comment: Form of Galway fourth hasn't worked out; absence to overcome; tongue-tied
runners.spotlight: Outran odds of 66-1 when fourth of 19 in bumper at the Galway festival behind Cameletta Vega; the form of that race hasn't worked out; 236-day absence to overcome; tongue-tied.

runners.name: Danalii
runners.comment: Dam sister to useful 2m-2m3f hurdle/chase winner; stable 0-26 in bumpers last 5 seasons
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam unraced sister to useful 2m-2m3f hurdle/chase winner Khage, half-sister to useful 2m-2m4f hurdle/chase winner Max Ward; stable 0-26 in bumpers last five seasons.

runners.name: Jaynemax
runners.comment: Dam bumper, 8.4f Flat and 2m hurdle winner, out of German 7f 2yo winner; no appeal
