runners.spotlight: Seventh foal; dam bumper, 8.4f Flat (RPR 65) and 2m hurdle winner, out of German 7f 2yo winner; makes no appeal on his debut.

runners.name: Courtmac Gesture
runners.comment: Half-sister to Coney Island; dam closely related to Wichita Lineman; yard 1-22 in bumpers
runners.spotlight: Eleventh foal; half-sister to Coney Island; unraced dam closely related to smart bumper and 2m4f-3m hurdle/chase winner Wichita Lineman; stable 1-22 in bumpers.

runners.name: Sharetheknowledge
runners.comment: Promise in a maiden and on h'cap bow, off since slipping up at Wexford, not discounted
runners.spotlight: 0-6 over hurdles but has shown ability; second in a Thurles maiden hurdle in January 2024; decent effort when fourth on handicap bow at Bellewstown; beaten when slipped up at Wexford when last sighted in August; might need this run but not fully discounted.

runners.name: Bossofthebus
runners.comment: Won here over 2m4f in January, couldn't repeat over 2m3f off 7lb higher, can't discount
runners.spotlight: Gained first win here when making all over 2m4f (soft) in January off 88; up 7lb and couldn't repeat the trick a month later over 2m3f; has had a six week break and has a chance if he can get back to the form of his course win.

quotes.race: Tipperary Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Bossofthebus seemed in good order again coming here today but you couldn't be confident after what he did in Sligo, and we were just hoping he'd run a nice race - Terence O'Brien, trainer.

runners.name: Tingarran Express
runners.comment: Course winner, held form well since, improve for comeback run last month, big chance
runners.spotlight: 1-28 over hurdles; that win came here over 16.5f on soft to heavy off 82; held her form well subsequently off higher marks; should improve for her comeback run last month, handles most ground and likes it here; leading chance.

runners.name: Robindevidastar
runners.comment: Three time hurdles winner, ran well here in January, 2m unsuitable latest, on a tough mark
runners.spotlight: Three time winner over hurdles; last success came at Punchestown (2m4f, good) in November off 84; 3l second of 15 off 7lb higher over 2m1f here in January; up another 4lb and struggled dropped to 2m here latest; may be on a tough mark.

quotes.race: William Hill Ireland Extra Places Every Day Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Robindevidastar had never had a gallop on grass but I was confident he would run a big race, I don't think he would want very heavy ground - Philip Rothwell, trainer.

runners.name: Southgate Avenue
runners.comment: No show in maidens, minor promise latest, 2lb lower and upped in trip, may outrun odds
runners.spotlight: Big prices and beaten long distances in maidens at 2m-2m4f; first glimmer of promise in second handicap start at Gowran on latest; dropped 2lb for that and steps back up in trip; could outrun odds.

runners.name: Western Opera
runners.comment: Well beaten at big odds in maidens, not obviously well treated for h'cap bow, check market
runners.spotlight: Triple figure odds and well beaten in maidens at 2m-2m3f on a variety of ground; not obviously well-treated for handicap debut but she's worth a market check.

runners.name: Old Kenmare
runners.comment: Midfield in a trio of maiden hurdles, best watched on h'cap debut unless market speaks
runners.spotlight: Long odds and midfield in three maidens at 2m-2m3f, including at this track on latest; best watched on handicap debut unless the market speaks in his favour.

runners.name: Weather Alert
runners.comment: Dual-purpose maiden, tame effort on h'cap hurdle debut, drops in trip, capable of better
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose maiden has shown ability on the Flat; yet to replicate over hurdles but still early days; drops back in trip after tame effort on handicap hurdle debut at Leopardstown earlier this month; should be capable of better at some point.

runners.name: Heidis Frontiere
runners.comment: 0-7 over hurdles, good efforts two of last three starts, this trip could suit well, chance
runners.spotlight: 0-7 over hurdles but has shaped well in two of her last three starts at 2m, including here on latest (raised 2lb); had excuses on penultimate over 2m4f at Fairyhouse; this trip could suit her well and she is one of the more likely ones.

runners.name: Close Enough
runners.comment: Sparingly raced since Limerick win in July 2023, off since August fall at Tramore, watch
runners.spotlight: Sole win came over 2m6f at Limerick in July 2023 off 80 and is 5lb higher now; sparingly raced since but did run ok over 3m here in September 2023; fell when last seen at Tramore in August; best watched on return from another layoff.

runners.name: Walk Of The Roses
runners.comment: Bumper winner for former yard, no impact in four runs for this stable, others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner for David Pipe; mild promise over hurdles but has failed to fire in three starts since moving to this yard; mark is sliding but she needs to turn her form around; others preferred.

runners.name: Tir Og
runners.comment: Promise last two starts including on h'cap debut here, down 1lb, claims
runners.spotlight: Glimmer of ability in her third maiden and again shaped with promise when a remote third of 13 on handicap debut here over 2m3f last month; that experience should stand to her and she could do better off 1lb lower; claims.

runners.name: Realtin Lonrach
runners.comment: 0-12 over hurdles, failed to complete three of last four, unseated latest, more needed
runners.spotlight: 0-12 over hurdles; best effort a 3.75l third at Wexford (2m1f, yielding to soft) in May 2024; failed to complete three of last four, unseating on latest when 28-1; more needed.

runners.name: Doyen Flyer
runners.comment: 0-11 over hurdles, ran well at Punchestown in January but hasn't backed that up; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; 0-11 over hurdles but has shown promise on occasion; best effort this season at Punchestown when a 5.5l fifth of 20 over 2m7f on heavy and 3lb lower now; failed to back that up twice since, however; others hold more pressing claims.

runners.name: Voice Of Reason
runners.comment: Flat winner, 0-15 over hurdles, good run at Cork in November, needs good ground; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; Flat winner is 0-15 over timber; best effort in this sphere a closing third over 16.5f on good ground at Cork off 104; well-treated on that form but may need faster ground.

runners.name: Highland Earl
runners.comment: H'cap debutant, mild promise in final maiden at Thurles, check the market; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; handicap debutant; not disgraced in third maiden hurdle start at Thurles (15.5f, good); related to a couple of winners over timber and he is worth a market check if getting a run.
